Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Visited with a group for a work retreat. Excellent location, rooms, service and food. I highly recommend it for this type of visit.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely A Five Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bob411
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal and this was one of the nicest properties I have seen. It reminded me of The Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles. The hotel at one time was a large personal residence and has maintained that feel. Small welcoming Lobby Living Room and beautiful old spanish structure. I stayed in a casita on the property of which there are a few. The room was magnificent and just recently remodeled. Fireplace, Patio overlooking garden and hammock and the mountains. All the first class amenities you would expect including a two headed shower and marble bath, king bed and comforable chairs in a beautiful color palette. The restaurant is also beautiful and the grounds with its winding paths and beautiful pool and spa area are a treat. I would strongly reccomend this hotel. It is one of those hotels that is not inexpensive but one where you leave thinking the value for your money spent was worth it. The service staff from the time you arrive until the time you leave is excellent !

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places to stay when on the road”
Reviews.Author: JandJMSP
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to stay at the Royal Palms on several occasions - all for meeting. This is a facility that is on par with the Ritz / Four Seasons level of service. What may elevate it is the room - I find it incredibly comfortable, large and inviting. This is a gem that if you are able, take advantage of the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: mcleanmom2
Reviews.Content: just returned from our Phoenix/Tucson trip and cannot recommend ENOUGH the Royal Palms Resort!!! From the moment we stepped out of our car until the moment we left, we were cared for royally. Every staff person went out of their way to be personally engaging and make us feel welcome and cared for. The designer casita was lovely and extremely comfortable. If I returned, I would try a casita near the back of the propery, simply for the view. Bed was super comfy, bathroom was huge and lovely. What made this stay exceptional? The service. At every turn, the service was beyond great. Thanks to all the staff. Be sure to visit Mona, the concierge. She will make your stay even better with directions, suggestions and help. We traveled to Arizona for spring break but also for an early 20th anniversary trip. Everyone helped us celebrate our marriage in great style!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Prescott2010
Reviews.Content: Royal Palms Resort and Spa is among the best hotels I have stayed at. It has great character and feel to it. The overall property is just beautiful with flowers and a great place to explore. Service was outstanding as usual. Celebrated my wife's birthday with dinner at T.Cook's - food was excellent. Had nice table on patio complete with rose petals. We both had spa treatments and found them to be just great. Nice place to escape with my wife! Staff is polite and always helpful. We have stayed several times at the Royal Palms and will keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Totally charming”
Reviews.Author: OlivierReykjavik
Reviews.Content: It has all the charm of a star hotel from the past (unusual in the U.S). Beautiful facilities, great updated rooms, magnificent restaurant - Breakfast and diner - genuine bar. Nice staff but not really organized, a bit messy, we guessed it part of the charm.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl M
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 nights at the Royal Palms. What a beautiful place! The service is outstanding. Just a tip- do not order the Royal Palm Ale at T. Cooks. It is extremely foamy and has a weird taste. I know beer, living in Portland, and this stuff is nasty. Save your money! The rooms are luxurious. Ask for one away from the road. If you are a light sleeper, you may hear the traffic. This is a smaller resort, and much more personal. Will go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can get better,but you can't pay more”
Reviews.Author: tony s
Reviews.Content: Went on an Amex platinum card fine hotels deal.This was a bad experience from a hotel that may be living off it's previous reputation.Room confusion,final room was tired with a poorly laid out bathroom,requested restaurant resv never communicated,I had to inquire at the on site rest.myself,service was spotty,which is what happens when you add an automatic $18/day service fee.Oh the fee did not cover an addl $3/day for the WSJ. Highlight for me was the outdoor landscaping

Reviews.Title: “A must-stay!”
Reviews.Author: BHS24
Reviews.Content: The high standards of the management is obvious everywhere you look, starting with the top-notch customer service at the front desk, to the incredible gardens and gorgeous guest rooms. Everyone you encounter at the Royal Palms seems intent on making sure you're stay is perfect. The attention to detail is evident in the spa, the bar, poolside, and in the restaurant. Housekeeping is exceptional as well. We were there in February and the days were sunny & warm. The attendants at the pool made sure everyone always had a glass of ice water (but their specialty cocktails were out-of-this-world delicious.) There are numerous water features and fountains around the grounds, but at night, when the air became chilly, we were thrilled to see fire in different forms all around the resort grounds. Plenty of secluded areas in the garden to relax & enjoy a fireplace or fire-pit while gazing at the stars. The air is perfumed with a unique scent, perhaps it was flowering jasmine? Be sure to look at the old black & white framed photos of the hotel. I believe some of them date back to the 1920s. This place exudes so much character & charm, you might feel like you're on a movie set.

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Leavita
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms Resort provided a fantastic vacation experience for my husband and I. (Our visit was in October.) It was quite lovely and it seems to employ only the highest caliber individuals. From the incredible office staff, who provided excellent recommendations for sight seeing, as well as the attentive wait staff, who provided exceptional service. I understand why the Royal Palms' T. Cook's Restaurant is considered one of the finest, if not THE finest, restaurants in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. Originally, we had planned on having only two breakfasts and two dinners there since we love trying different resturants, but by the last day, we were having breakfast, lunch and dinner there. There was no reason to go anywhere else. And the location of the Royal Palms is perfect. While you are lying by the pool, you feel like you are miles off the beaten track when in fact, the entrance is actually on a main street that leads to every place you would want to get to in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, home away from home”
Reviews.Author: michelle0404
Reviews.Content: Stayed in montecito terrace upstairs. Great view of camelback mountain. Food fantastic (2 meals a day to help!!!). Great location not far from centre of Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: SuperPicky111
Reviews.Content: The gardens are the most beautiful I've ever seen, just stunning; the definition of lush and manicured landscaping. The grounds look like a beautiful estancia type compound. We chose Royal Palms because we were looking for luxury but not a mega Vegas-type resort with thousands of people. At Royal Palms we had a ground floor room in Montevista, which is the new section. Room was modern, amenities nice, but ceilings a bit low. If we were to return would look for a top floor room. Pool was nice, although small. Spa was nice, not super luxurious, but well appointed. I had a massage and the technican was phenomenal. Location is great, right next to restaurants, shopping and Camelback mountain. Service was very good, definitely top notch all around from concierge to valet to spa to restaurant. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: MJCharleston
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Beautiful grounds; beautiful room with every amenity you can think of; friendly, professional service; delicious food; great spa. Expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE This Place! Didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: jormom2003
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this resort for business trips--unfortunately did not have much time to enjoy it this time around, but this place is a gorgeous, converted and modernized old mansion--gorgeous grounds with several courtyards with fountains, seating, fireplaces, palm trees, flowers, etc, etc..not too mention amazing views of Camelback mountain and other surrounding formations! It's a cozy, intimate place to stay..not too big and sprawling, just right. A very nice pool area with outdoor dining/bar area next to it and cabanas for rental. The main restaurant, T. Cook's, is really exceptional as well--interesting food, good mix, good wine list, great wait staff. I was put in a "Spa Suite" room this time around--unbelievable! Huge, beautiful with a fireplace and it opened onto the beautiful larger courtyard area with fountains, a fireplace, and pergolas...again with breath taking views of Camelback Mountain. The entire resort staff was great--polite, courteous, attentive...very pleasant. Of course 75-80 degree weather in mid-March made it all even more enjoyable! Wish I could have stayed longer. One of these days would like to come back for a pleasure trip and check out their spa as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: Well-located and secluded. The grounds were interesting and fun to explore. Restaurant was great. A bit over priced, but not too much.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: halleybopp
Reviews.Content: We loved it here. We stayed three nights and were sad to go. The spa was ultra relaxing and T. Cooks is the best restaurant in town by far. Great service and beauty all around. The one opportunity this hotel has is to heat the pool. The weather was quite mild and the pool was super chilly. I am already planning my trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel special”
Reviews.Author: Judy S
Reviews.Content: I felt as tho' I was an elite guest rather than just a first time visitor. The little touches added by the staff made our weekend stay so pleasant and relaxing. The lush greenery and beautiful flowering plants transformed a space in the desert into the garden of my dreams.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except for...”
Reviews.Author: Firenze1962
Reviews.Content: I was at the Royal Palms during winter break last week. My husband and I took our teenage son. We stayed in one of the Valencia rooms and even though they are close to the road, it was fine because my son had his own room. He could close doors and have his own bedroom. Traffic noise was minimal/ The grounds are spectacular and the resort is so quiet even though it was almost at full capacity. We did see a few empty glasses and wine bottles in some areas of the property on Sunday morning. They were probably left over from Saturday night. We were surprised that they had not been cleaned. The atmosphere is relaxed and the service is truly superb. Spa services were also top notch. The only exception was dinner at T. J. Cook's. Our breakfasts at the restaurant were very good (the bar menu looked great) but when we went for dinner we were very disappointed. My husband's paella (their signature dish) was dry. My son's steak was overcooked even though he ordered it medium. His roasted vegetables were inedible (very, very roasted). I ordered the Carbonara and the top layer was very dry. It seems that the pasta was put in the over and this formed a dry pasta layer on top. Stay at the resort, by all means, but skip dinner at the restaurant. Go to one of the many fine restaurants in the area, i.e. Marcellino.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old World Casita Style Layout!”
Reviews.Author: Mikeandjennn
Reviews.Content: Love the feel of the grounds! Very relaxing and different. Rooms very nice, casita style. Service great as well. Favorite of all fine hotels in Phoenix, AZ area.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelNow61
Reviews.Content: This is an older resort has has been well maintained. Small and cozy with excellent customer service. Excellent restaurant on site.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: jkhall19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a belated Valentine's Day weekend here and it couldn't have been better. From the lounge, to the award-winning restaurant (T Cooks), to the rooms, everything/everyone was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel702
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been several times to dinner at TCook's but only stayed over for the first time recently (the rooms are always booked!). The food at the restaurant is fantastic. We LOVE coming to this hotel for the charming ambience, beautiful architecture and gardens. I am always excited when we pull up the palm lined drive to such a relaxing little oasis. The staff are very friendly, efficient and accommodating. We stayed in a spa suite which was lovely and quiet- even though it was next to Camelback road. The room was great- a bit dark as it was long and narrow but very well laid out. You enter the "living room" which had a daybed & minibar then walk through the bathroom to reach the bedroom. Bathroom has pocket doors you can close on both the bedroom and living room side. Bedroom opened to a public courtyard with fountains and a fireplace and there was a fireplace in the bedroom. The bathroom worked even though it was so open- I especially liked the soaking tub but did not like only 1 sink. The ceilings were very low and normally this really bothers me at hotels, but somehow with the furnishings, fireplace and light fixtures it felt cozy and romantic- not cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Oasis”
Reviews.Author: sap811
Reviews.Content: Wow was I in for a treat when I went to a meeting at the Royal Palms. this is a jewel of a hotel. I really enjoyed the decor of the room and the great food. Definitely deserves another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Saskatchewan83
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is perfect...everything. The service, the beds, the rooms, Keurig coffee makers. The pool area is a wonderful place to spend the day. Extremely romantic, and food is incredible. Try the poutine! It's a great location, but we really didn't want to leave the property. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: 1995sb21
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this property are the most beautiful we have experienced in the Phoenix area. Unfortunately our room, a valencia casita, was not the most beautiful. I made the mistake of not reserving a designer casita, which apparently are updated. Our casita was old, the lay out was odd and the bathroom was just like a best western. I really enjoy having a beautiful room with a great large bathtub in the bathroom. We were offered to upgrade to a terrace room but it was a bit small, the japanese soaking tub in the room was like a small jacuzzi but the way it is you are not able to lay down in the water. You have to be sitting upright as though you are on a step in the very deep end of a pool. Our lunch that we had in T-Cooks was good, cocktail hour in the bar was fun and I will definitely be back so long as I book a designer casita. I was sad to leave the gorgeous grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Old School, Lovely Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMH18
Reviews.Content: Old Hollywood style, subdued, classy resort with excellent onsite spa. Not as glamorous as newer resorts, but somehow more authentic. Wonderful historic architecture, esthetically pleasing common areas. Great proximity to hiking Camelback Mountain, although once there, it is tempting not to leave. Resort fee seemed high at first, but made sense once they clarified that it includes most gratuities while on site. Restaurant was spendy, and menu offerings somewhat limited...quality of food was good, but not memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and grounds”
Reviews.Author: chr_8
Reviews.Content: This lovely historic hotel was a nice base for our stay in Phoenix. The grounds are magical at night . The highlight of our stay was the time spent in the gorgeous spa, the atmosphere of which is incredibly calming. The front desk gave us the wrong spa hours so be sure to check with the spa directly if you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: JeffMercedes
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel. Gorgeous grounds. Loved the pool area and the outdoor fire pits. Beautiful ambience around every corner. Came for a meeting, brought along the family. My kids loved the pool, hot tub and entire place (actually they just loved Arizona in general and now want to move!!). We will definitely be back to Royal Palms!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Setting, Service & Food”
Reviews.Author: FrankieD2851
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving 2011 here to visit family in Phoenix. It was a wonderful experience in every sense one could imagine. The grounds are beautiful, cozy while feeling spacious at the same time. Private but very friendly with one of the best staffs we have ever encountered at a resort or hotel. Eventhough we like to try different resorts and hotels when we travel to the same area we will always return to the Royal Palms when in Phoenix and Scottsdale, AZ.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, great food and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: TONYfromTO
Reviews.Content: We only stayed the night but the treatment by the staff both at reception and throughout the day was fit for royality, which indeed we felt like during our stay. The food was ordered and we enjoyed it on our private patio overlooking a beautiful garden. The pool area is very small but intimate. We cooled off in the pool and then relaxed in a garden setting with a few Margaritas. Great setting for a romanitic get away. The rooms are big and the beds are very comfortable. Can't wait to go back and this time we will be spending a few days there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Atmosphere - Too Bad the Food Isn't”
Reviews.Author: jon2036
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort, although expenside, steeped in old-world Mexican atmosphere in a very private setting. But the food is not commensurate with the hotel's alleged high standards. A Chicken Ceasar Salad at lunch, for example, was fit for a Perkin's Restaurant. Actually, Perkins might serve a better food. Don't expect outstanding cuise at the Royal Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience in the Phoenix area!”
Reviews.Author: KristieJaye
Reviews.Content: This is by far thee best place to stay in Phoenix. From arrival to departure the staff makes sure you feel at home. We hosted a wedding there and have been going back every since, not just us; but our daughter and new son-in-law go back and so do all the guests! We love it.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY”
Reviews.Author: deenaelattar
Reviews.Content: Excellency in all aspects! Highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a nice luxury stay in AZ

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: alison245
Reviews.Content: From the terrific bellman to the spa staff, this resort has some of the best service of any 5 star hotel I have been to. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Romance and Luxury at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Couple_Kam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are both in the military and with deployments and currently being stationed at different ends of the country, we seldom get to see each other. We had heard good things about the Royal Palms and so I decided to have us meet here for a week of romance. I worked with Mr. Vickrey and Sean over at T Cook's before arrival and planned one of the Via Capello experiences with them. It was an azmazing experience and our waiter Rodrigo was top-notch, one of the best out there. The whole set-up of romantic experiences like the Via Capello dinners are well worth it. The property goes out of its way to make sure that everything about the requests you make with goes exactly as planned and delivers the best in privacy, romance, and most of all, luxury. Our room was excellent and we took advantage of all it had to offer, including the great views right from our own balcony. The room was much more spacious than the floor plan let on...we took a few trips around town with Jenna's help at the concierge and she steered us wonderfully every step of the way. I can't say enough good things about the service, old world charm, understated 5-star luxury (you feel like a king, yet you also feel comfortable walking down to the pool in a bathrobe and bathing suit), and the exceptional detail given to your every desire by the staff (they ALL remembered mine and y wife's name). I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for romance and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel - great location - excellent atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: mdbasile
Reviews.Content: If you like smaller boutique hotels, one cannot do much better than the royal palms. The location is perfect and the setting is romantic and well layer out. The rooms are spacious and the grounds are impeccable - the restaurant, bar and spa a also top notch. For the money one cannot do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel and spa but disorganized”
Reviews.Author: Knightsfreedom
Reviews.Content: Our Christmas gift to ourselves was an afternoon at the Spa. We took advantage of their Thursday special of a trio package for each of us which was a good value. Unfortunately all of the treatments we had booked ahead of time got completely messed up and after having our first treatments the others were completely wrong and could not be fixed due to overbooking. My husband was waiting over 30 min only to find out they did not have his massage scheduled at right time with female masseuse. They ended up comping the services I had but it still ruined the whole afternoon plan. Facilities were very charming but I know my husband will not be back. We ended up doing drinks at the hotel bar and the hors d'oevres were really great.

Reviews.Title: “xmas get-away”
Reviews.Author: gary p
Reviews.Content: lovely resort with a great staff, service was exceptional. we have stayed at many other hotels/resorts in the area, we believe the Royal Palms has become our number one place to stay from now on...Thanks to Monique and all at the Palms for a wonderful xmas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mmerdock1
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with character. I stayed in the "run of the house" rooms for $130/night. First impressions is the small size, but that was easily compensated by the tasteful furniture, and really comfy bed. A huge deeep bathtub with plantation shutters opening into the room dominated the posh bathroom. Little candles were provided complimenting the ambience of the room. It also has a separate glass shower cubical and toilet. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. There was a resort fee of $28 / day imposed at check-in but the free wifi and ALL gratuities are included in this and even when I tried to tip the guy who brought my bag to the room, he re-affirmed the policy that tipping wasnt necessary (I did anyway). Defintly return to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, refined, secluded, restful, and romanatic destination with 5 Diamond service.”
Reviews.Author: Rick K
Reviews.Content: It was a visit locally for our Weddinfg Anniversary and the Royal Palms staff took every step to make sure it was mentioned to us at every chance, congratulated us, and made us feel special and the only ones they were dealing with or cared about at every step. Room was an upgraded Spa Suite wiht a beatuiful patio, outdoor area ajacent, and the 2 room interior of other 5 Diamond resorts for much less cost. Dinner was another dedicated event for us at T. Cooks with menus enscribed for the event with our date and years, and dedicated attention to detail with a desert noted with the date and years again. Romance package gives you great turndown service with rose petals, champagnee and chocalate covered strawberries. Try the Mediterranian Eggs Benedict the next morning for the perfect stay finisher.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent getaway”
Reviews.Author: Lovelytripper
Reviews.Content: The service was impeccable. The grounds were gorgeous. The spa was excellent. If you're trying to pick between here and sanctuary (like I was), trust me choose here. You'll love the cozy & romantic aura.....and yes they know you by name.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: roesweld
Reviews.Content: Had a reservation for the Royal Palms December and since I told them at the desk that Dec 26 was my wife's birthday, they upgraded our room. It was a fantastic upgrade. I would recommend this for anyone wanting service and a super staff

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: tc_travel_talk
Reviews.Content: We had a very brief stay at this hotel and are really looking forward to coming back. The place is beautiful. We had a lovely breakfast outside at T.Cooks -- and enjoyed the spa and lounging at the pool. Service was fabulous. The room was also nice . Fireplace added to the ambiance. I liked the small size as well - very calm and relaxing !

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: atltammyb
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this location, we were treated like royalty. The spa staff was amazing. My massage with Nick is the ABSOLUTE BEST massage, I've ever had! The room was quaint and cozy. The fireplace was a nice touch. I would recommend this place looking for a romantic escape. The landscape was well kept and immaculate! The view is incredible. I will definitely visit this location again! Kudos Royal Palms!!!! Nick, thank you thank you thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JWMarriottStarrPass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a weekend getaway and we felt like we flew to another world. The property is beautiful and well taken care of. The service was absolutely amazing and we felt welcome, even through all of their holiday parties. It was probably the best night sleep I have had in years and the Spa was to die for. The fitness facility is not that big, and can get crowded early. We will definitely go back and I look forward to recommending it to everyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star - at least my room wasn't!”
Reviews.Author: BreezyK
Reviews.Content: I am currently in Room 303 at a business conference and I am being treated to the relentless droning of traffic on E Camelback Road. My room over looks the parking lot facing the main road. Not a five star view, not peaceful. Here is a picture so you can judge for yourself. Some of my colleagues scored significantly better rooms so I think this hotel is a case of hit or miss. Some of the rooms have fireplaces and patios and NO traffic noise. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. The service is okay, nothing special but I'm here with a big group so maybe I'm just lost in the shuffle. Unfortunately, I think there may be rooms worse than mine. One of my colleagues said her room was tiny and smelled bad so she immediately turned around and demanded a better room. All of the reviews rave about this hotel but if you get stuck in one of the crummy rooms this place could really be a disappointment for you. If you get a good room I'm pretty sure you will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Best Thanksgiving!”
Reviews.Author: Ava2455
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palm is not a typical hotel. As my family said it felt like home not a hotel. It is old time elegant. You feel and are treated very special by the staff. You can tell they were hand picked not just run of the mill. The hotel was so secluded and private, but so close to downtown Scottsdale. The grounds are beautiful and no detail is left out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Post Ironman Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Kujo96
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a normal type of hotel prior to the Ironman Arizona. But after the race we wanted to get away from the downtown hustle and have a nice relaxing celebration. The hotel was so secluded and private, yet it felt larger than the hundred or so rooms there. The spa was very nice and gave a good post race massage. Loved the fireplaces.

Reviews.Title: “Board Meeting Cocktail Party”
Reviews.Author: NICCMBoard
Reviews.Content: The Palms provided an all around excellent experience while contracting and during the event. The staff was knowledgeable and helpful and the catering manager was a delight to work with and remained flexible the entire time. We will definitely work with them again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “"Off the Charts" This hotel is almost too fabulous to be true!.”
Reviews.Author: Gene W
Reviews.Content: It's a shame that so many people will miss this experience at the Royal Palms. Just over 100 beautiful rooms & casitas and 300 employees makes it easy to be pampered. Everything was just right with our stay. The layout and beauty of the property is exempliary, from the palm trees and bouganvillas, the lovely pool and surrounding nooks and cranies. The Mediterranian/Spanish architecture was beyond compare. I can't go on like this unless I risk making a reader think that I was paid to say these things! And, I assure you that I was not. The place is just awesome!

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: TinafromMunich
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days at the Royal Palms and enjoyed every minute of it. I didn't want to leave and am sure we will be back. The staff were very friendly. All of them, all the time. Nobody ever asked me for my room number; they did ask for my name. The grounds are really well kept, the spa has a great atmosphere. Do book your appointments early to not be disappointed. I did not get all the treatments I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing as usual”
Reviews.Author: chris h
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong here. It's a beautiful resort and the staff is very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: StlmanChuck
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel was well maintained and landscaping in excellent condition

Reviews.Title: “Deserves #1 Rating”
Reviews.Author: AnnieLSantaFe
Reviews.Content: Everything was superb. We were in Phoenix for both business and pleasure and the entire visit felt like a vacation thanks to the remarkable service and the hotel itself. We dined at T. Cook's a number of times during our three-day stay and it is sublime. Very, very good. A bit pricey, but worth it. Also took advantage of their spa to have a massage. It was the best spa experience I have had at a hotel. Really great. Will stay whenever we possibly can on our trips to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: cadkison
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming and beautiful, with many courtyards, fountains, colorful flowers, and comfortable and lovely places to sit, sun, read, or eat outside. Once a private residence and now expanded, the architecture is aged terra cotta/adobe with red Spanish tiles. The service is impeccable. Just sit by the pool for a moment to read your emails on your iPhone, and someone immediately shows up with a glass of ice water and makes sure you have everything you need. I love the daily activities fee -- no tipping to worry about except for food and drink. The fellows who handle the valet service are quick and friendly and helpful. The check-in desk is staffed by warm and helpful people who can't do enough. The rooms are luxurious and tasteful -- not fussy or ostentatious . T Cook's (restaurant) is highly ranked and deserves to be -- absolutely delicious food, reasonably priced for what it is. Nice bar. We loved all the chances to eat and enjoy cocktails outside, morning, noon, and night. Because the walkways wind around (with beautiful surprises at every turn), it's easy to get a little lost at first, but someone always appears to direct you -- actually they walk you to your destination, chatting along the way. I was there for a board meeting (and must say the accommodations and food for the meeting were superb), and we all liked the Royal Palms so much that we voted to have every third meeting here from now on -- and this by a group that meets all over the Us and is never uniformly satisfied. I saw both rooms and casitas -- all exquisite. Go now and stay as long as you can! And take me with you!

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave the property”
Reviews.Author: Jon and stacey s
Reviews.Content: I got a buddy deal so I picked this place. Now I have to figure out how to stay here again! My family is very active and just hanging out is not what we do until we came here and realized we did not want to leave the grounds. The flowers are so beautiful and some are from the South Pacific, who would think you would find that in the desert. Service was fantastic, even after we left when we had them send us some items we had left in the room. Brunch a T. Cooks was very enjoyable too.

Reviews.Title: “No words to describe”
Reviews.Author: Roselle N
Reviews.Content: How amazing the Royal Palms is. The property was under construction during my visit, and it merely added to the atmosphere. The rooms, the location, the staff, the amenities...just go. I have been to Phoenix and Scottsdale plenty, and will not stay anywhere but the Royal Palms after my first time there. It's beautiful, it's charming, it's a treasure for the city to have such a place.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the world's best hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindenHills
Reviews.Content: We spent two days here after a 3 day stay at the Enchantment spa in Sedona...I was not exactly worn out when I arrived at the Royal Palms. The staff were prompt and friendly, all of them reception, concierge, car valet, pool attendants, bartender, maids, groundsmen....it didn't seem to matter who served us, they were capable, friendly and gracious without an ounce of stuffiness. Unfailingly perfect service. The grounds are exquisite. Beautiful and tasteful without being over the top. Lush gardens. We were planning to go to the botanical garden in Phoenix, in fact we had several plans that were dropped because we were so content to enjoy the amenities at the Royal Palms. We ordered lunch at the pool cabana and were happy with the quality, the 'just right' sized portions and prices that were very reasonable. We had an adjoining suite with a lovely balcony overlooking two pools and numerous fire places and pits. An inviting place to lounge on a cool evening after being out out.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing place ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sockmo
Reviews.Content: This is such an amazing place to stay! The grounds are beautiful and there are all sorts of nooks and crannies to explore. Even though we got the cheapest room, it was beautiful and very large. The staff was friendly and did everything possible to make our stay relaxing. Even though it was over 100 degrees, we felt very comfortable in our room or walking around the grounds. Even though I would say the Royal Palms is best for couples, the staff was very accommodating of our 9 month old daughter. No one ever made us feel uncomfortable about having a baby in such a nice place. A little tip: the sweet potato fries from the poolside cafe were the most delicious I've tasted!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service,location and facilities.”
Reviews.Author: ccass
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay from the moment I checked in. All the staff members were so nice and professional from the bell staff,reception,pool side to housekeeping,bar staff and restaurant staff.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent relaxing short stay”
Reviews.Author: Timbob23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night after staying in LA and Vegas, prior to returning back to the UK via the local Phoenix Skyway airport where BA fly out from to the UK once a day. The hotel is set in a lovely location, the service is absolutely excellent, the staff very friendly, knowledgeable and professional and the restaurant is top notch. The only small criticism I have was the noise of my fellow (drunken/loud!) guests returning to their rooms via the corridor was noticeable in my room (our room was located at the entrance to the apartments at the top of a flight of stairs that I could hear the guests walking up and down on), though I appreciate that this is a common problem with hotels generally. Although a bit pricey I would absolutely recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service I've ever had anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Pat G
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference that was being held at The Phoenician, but did not reserve accommodations in time to get a room at the conference hotel. Royal Palms was the overflow hotel, so I booked my room there. At first I was disappointed to be staying at the smaller, seemingly less luxurious property. But after the first day, I was in love with this place and the people who worked there. Every single staff member I encountered asked what they could do to help me and made me feel like their sole purpose for coming to work that day was to make my stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible. If I asked how to get somewhere on the property, they didn’t point and give me directions . . . they escorted me there and made sure I had everything I needed. I extended my stay and did get to spend a single night at The Phoenician at the close of the conference. It was an extravagantly beautiful and luxurious property, but the customer service there couldn’t hold a candle to what I experienced at Royal Palms. It’s probably been five years since I was there, but I still talk about what a wonderful experience that was. I’ve stayed at five-star properties in L.A., San Francisco, Las Vegas and New York City, and none of them could hold a candle to the warm welcome and customer service I received at Royal Palms. Well done, Royal Palms!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Ashur_K475
Reviews.Content: I went to Phoenix for my brothers birthday and stayed and this hotel for a week. I paid for a worth while hotel in the area. I was happy that my dog could also come along too because he has too much anxiety when home alone. The staff are friendly and the food was awesome. To my suprise my dog had no problems when I left him alone for a bit during the birthday. I will stay here again on his next b-day

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with one small exception...”
Reviews.Author: Partyofone61
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this lovely little hotel for two nights October 6-8. I found it to be excellent with one small exception. For the first night, I experienced a great deal of overhead noise from the room above, so much so that I was awakened at 3:00am and was unable to return to sleep. Given the fact that one of my reasons for choosing this hotel was to rest, that issue was a bit disconcerting. Fortunately, the party above me checked out on the second night, and all was well. I highly recommend this hotel, but if you are sensitive to noise as I am, you would do well to ask for a second floor or single story accommodation. Other than that, the hotel is delightful, and I was well pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day 2011 Stay”
Reviews.Author: defreytasjt
Reviews.Content: Recently, my husband and I stayed at the Royal Palms for 3 nights for a wedding. This place is fantastic. The service and friendliness of the staff is hard to beat. It is a smaller resort with all of the big resort amenities, which is something that we loved about this place. The Royal Palms is conveniently located between the Biltmore area and Scottsdale, which made it very easy to get around quickly. Short trip from airport. Will stay here again and recommend to anyone heading to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Romance”
Reviews.Author: gizmoblume
Reviews.Content: My husband and I try to stay at the loyal palms once a year. We first visited this resort 7 years ago. It was such a great experience to the wonderful and beautiful grounds, to the neat and unique hotel suites. My husband and I found ourselves heading back there again and again. After our fifth stay my husband popped the question in one of their many gardens. If you have not had the opportunity to stay at this resort, find the time. They have some special for this fall right now as well.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjfisher
Reviews.Content: We had the most fantastic stay for four days in this exceptional hotel and I wish it had been longer. The staff were outstanding and couldn't have done more for us to ensure we had a wonderful time. We would definitely stay here again should we go back to Scottsdale and I can't recommend it enough. The restaurant was outstanding and we enjoyed the meals we had there very much.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Anniversary experience”
Reviews.Author: EPE99
Reviews.Content: The hotel, restaurant, and staff are phenomenal. I can honestly say that this was the singularly best experience I have had at a hotel/ resort. They went out of their way to ensure that my first anniversary was amazing and truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: 2Q4W
Reviews.Content: This is our 8th visit to this resort! It's like coming home! Every one is so friendly service is excellent! Jose poolside is a treasure and so obliging - as are front desk valet Jason bar chef and Chef Lee - combined with a first rate spa make this the ideal chill out Cleaning staff need to be a little more vigilant on closing patio doors firmly - Although the hotel has excellent security our doors have on several occasions been left slightly ajar - the hotel has as always compensated us for this mishap Look forward to another restful stay next year

Reviews.Title: “Relax amidst serenty and nature”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit. I spent 3 nights attending a conference. My Casita was so welcoming. The staff could not have been more attentive. The grounds and accommodations are first class but still extremely comfortable. I can't say enough about Chef Lee and the menu at T. Cook's. You can get away from it all here and yet have everything you need and never leave the grounds. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: chelseabarm
Reviews.Content: I was so mad ay my husband for booking such an expensive hotel for just me (it was my pre-baby gift) but it was worth every cent. Best customer service I have encountered anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Small Resort”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Palms for 6 nights, total in a Designer Casita. Rooms are beautiful if a little dark. Service was top notch without being obnoxious. Jose, at the pool, is amazingly good at his job. Excellent service, wonderfully friendly, never had an empty drink. Food at T. Cook's is good. Would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: ILG9281
Reviews.Content: Amazing attention to detail, experienced and friendly staff, quite relaxing environment yet fun! Close to Town, convenient location. Restaurant and pool service were also impeccable. I would and will visit again. If you are looking for a peaceful place to stay that is super lux this is your place! You can easily get to any nightlife/restaurants then come back and enjoy a restful environment. You don't have to worry about noisy guests keeping you up or bothering you in any way. The staff will go over and above to make sure you have a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: frankmcs
Reviews.Content: In today's world, great customer service is rare. The Royal Palms is truly a rare find. The only time you hear the word no to a request is in there signature reply- "No Worries". Service is top notch throughout the resort and all take the time to not only remember your name but incredibly anticipate most of your desires. The real standouts here are the pool staff. Jose and Matt go above and beyond every day and greet any request with a genuine smile. They make sure each guest has a relaxing stay. I also have to send out extra kudos to the valet staff. Never once had to wait for my car and they were also ready with any directions you might need. Finally, please check out the Alvadora Spa. I got a 90 minute massage and truly melted on the table. This was our 3rd stay at Royall Palms and am already anxious to return. A big Thank You to all the staff for making our week long stay an incredible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overall”
Reviews.Author: mark3r80
Reviews.Content: The resort is very well maintained and the staff is outstanding. Service on all levels was excellent and the staff truly made my stay enjoyable. I stayed in a first floor room, and the only concern was that I could hear the occupant above me walking around very clearly. I will certainly stay at the resort again, but would request a second floor room.

Reviews.Title: “This place defines "WOW Factor"”
Reviews.Author: Ibbocek
Reviews.Content: This resort is a must stay if you are visiting Phoenix. The moment we drove up the spectacular drive to the resort we were greeted with the most amazing valet staff. Every detail has been taken care of from check in to check out - we were treated like royalty. The views from our room were breathtaking and the gardens and pool area were heavenly. We arrived on Saturday August 27th and were planning to have dinner at T. Cooks. Unfortunately (due to my error) they were fully booked for a 7pm seating. The director of romance met us and offered us other times but said that if we booked for Sunday then he would provide us with a special evening - and special it was. We were seated at the best table in the restaurant and it was adorned with rose pedals. We received a complimentary glass of champagne and dessert along with a monogramed menu - truly first class, thank you Robert! This resort is so beautiful that I want to pack my bags and go back now.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, top notch service, beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Gterv
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a designer casita, lovely decoration, quiet hotel, relaxing, absolutely perfect service, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little resort in the middle of Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Promed
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with family at this resort hotel which has an interesting history. Price was quite reasonable and it seems like a nice getaway, as you don't feel like you are in the middle of a major city. Room was nice but not overly large.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort. Will definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: AJ J
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and really liked the quiet quaint setting. Perfect weekend getaway to relax and recharge. Great, Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the valley”
Reviews.Author: MichaelGomez
Reviews.Content: From start to finish the most relaxing and romantic hotel I've ever been to. The grounds are amazing for an evening or early morning stroll . The pool is very well taken care of. The level of customer service is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “My recent stay at Royal Palms Resort and Spa exceeded my expectations! Customer service was outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: splauman
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed an amazing weekend! The staff was professional and courteous and very accommodating! Charming ambiance and superb customer service! ~ I look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “THE best service and breathtaking scenery”
Reviews.Author: BBoopL
Reviews.Content: One if the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Stayed here over labor day weekend and cannot get over how charming, cozy, and beautiful it was. All the good reviews could not be more accurate. The service staff was the most consistently great staff we've ever encountered. This can't be a fluke or good luck, must be part of their business plan! Weeks before we arrived, concierge Mona helped not just with suggestions but made arrangements for every detail from hot air ballooning to horseback riding to spa appointment. She kept in touch through email and phone calls to clarify details of our trip and to remind us of all sorts of things (like don't plan any outdoor activities between 9a and sunset during the Arizona summer! - thank goodness she warned us!). Upon arrival we met the quickest and most courteous valets in the business. While we were still pulling in looking lost at 11p trying to make sure we were in the right spot, two valets appeared, one on each side of the car and gently whisked away the car keys and our luggage and took care of everything! Everytime we needed the car they had it waiting for us outside in what seemed to be under 60seconds and every time we returned we were always greeted with two valets to help escort us and our baggages out of the car. At the pool was a staff of one gentleman (jose) who was unbelievably efficient, friendly, and ran the operation like a well oiled machine. It was scary how he always seemed to anticipate our every need well before we even realized it. Before we realized we were parched he was right there with large cups of lemon ice water - and refilled it well before it ever reached halfway empty. If we looked a little uncomfortable from a towel that was too wet, before we could decide what to do Jose was there with a dry towel...and he provided this degree of excellent service to every guest at the pool! We loved how well this resort seamlessly blended indoor and outdoor space. Very classy and comforting decor all around. We stayed in one of the designer casitas. Very cozy and clean, but was disappointed that patio doors opened up to communal walking path and there was no view of the mountains. Will try for a balcony suite next time. Room may not be as spacious as other resorts, but decor very unique - they even had some classic books laying on ledges around the room which was a nice touch. Spa massages were okay, and once again decor and use of indoor/outdoor space made it worth experiencing. Planning our next trip back already!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property in scenic location”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful upscale property without being over the top. A luxurious yet rustic, authentic feel to the place. Attentive friendly staff. Delicious food that is organically grown. All in all a class act.

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel like a movie star in old Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: statsteacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a Valencia suite, and loved it as much as the Ritz-Carlton resorts we've stayed in. The service level is very good, and the feel of the property is amazingly exclusive. That's partly because the resort is small (and so more personal). It's also because the grounds have been carefully designed with many plants, flowers, and courtyards, so that the overall sense is of "old money" and privacy. It made us feel rich, and we didn't break the bank staying there! The rooms are not as luxurious as the grounds, though they are definitely well-appointed and spacious. You won't mind, though, because you'll want to spend your time exploring the courtyards and hanging out at the pool. The spa was gorgeous, and also broken in smaller rooms for privacy and comfort. Other pluses: the on-site restaurant is excellent for both breakfast and dinner; the valets are quick and friendly; the resort fee explicitly covers tips (except for meals and spa services). The cocktails at the lounge are very good, and half-price during happy hour. A few weaker points: the pool is on the small side, creating a little tension between families whose kids want to play and the adults who want to drift aimlessly about or sit near the edge with their Blackberrys or books. The staff did a fine job managing the situation. The turn-down service ran far too late for our tastes, so that we had to decline services on several evenings. Finally, a good deal of noise carries between floors and not all rooms have balconies or patio areas -- ask for a top-floor room, and for a balcony if that matters to you. Overall, we loved it, and we look forward to future trips!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous stay, as always - I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Phoenix.”
Reviews.Author: Alyssa P
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Arizona most of my life, I've stayed at all the big resorts in the Phoenix area... The Phoenician, Sanctuary, The Princess... you name it. All of them are nice but none have the charm, warmth and personal touch that the Royal Palms does. In season, the property can be quite pricey. However, the summer rates are quite a bargain (if you can handle the heat!).

Reviews.Title: “Unique, upscale without the stuffiness of a Four Season or Ritz.”
Reviews.Author: Abbey W
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was home the entire time. Great staff, friendly, helpful, accommodating and welcoming. Can't wait to get back to AZ to stay at the Royal Palms!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, luxurious, and romantic”
Reviews.Author: lisathompson
Reviews.Content: This incredibly tranquil estate was originally a rambling mansion built in the 1920's by a private owner. After changing hands a few times, someone had the vision to make it a resort around 1995, and what a resort it is!!! It just feels like you are on private property- not at a public resort. We were simply entranced upon arrival. The lush, Spanish-feeling grounds twist and turn with many walkways, a few courtyards, porticos and many private nooks. The heady scent of all the flowers that grace the grounds, mingled with scents emanating from the spa, is intoxicating. Entering our room, we were greeted by low-lighting, a relaxing CD playing gently in the background, gorgeous decor, and the most comfortable bed and pillows. ( I'm really big on bed comfort..that's THE most important thing to me.) When you enter the extremely private, quiet pool area, you are gently greeted with an ice-cold glass of water with lemon, and the most comfortable chaise lounges. We were at Royal Palms for 2 nights, then took a trip to Sedona where we stayed at a mediocre hotel for a night. We had planned to stay in Sedona for two nights, but when we called the Royal Palms to see if they had availability for that night, they gave us a great rate that wasn't much different than the dull Sedona hotel, and we gleefully raced back to Royal Palms! Really, Royal Palms wonderfully appeals to every one of the 5 senses. The outdoor fireplaces, fantastic service, and the feeling that you are somewhere in Spain, not Arizona, all contributed to my favorite stay anywhere in the United States!

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave”
Reviews.Author: missy12329
Reviews.Content: Everything I had always heard about was true. I didn't want to leave the pool area. Attendants were fabulous. Am ready to go back and only been home one day

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I stayed in !”
Reviews.Author: Toine M
Reviews.Content: The resort is excellent. Our family had two rooms next to eachother in the "valencia" area. The interiour is very nice and spotless clean. The service of the staff is great. The pool area is beautifull and they do everyting to make you feel comfortable. We had dinner and breakfast in the resort and great value for money. The quality of the dishes and the wine selection was superb. Would recommend this resort to anyone who is visiting Phoenix

Reviews.Title: “Romantic gem”
Reviews.Author: BennieKatz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary with a 3 night stay at the Royal Palms Resort in Phoenix. It was amazing. The hotel and grounds are absolutely beautiful. It felt intimate and quiet. Our room was gorgeous with a balcony, fireplace, deep soaking tub and steam shower. The staff was friendly and helpful. We loved the spa and had a wonderful time and the pool and bar. The food and service at T-Cooks were 5 star. Special place - We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay and impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: brentond
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived through the time we departed our stay was superb! The grounds are beautiful, poolside service was prompt and friendly. Musicians in the lounge were wonderful and our room was luxurious and comfortable. I think we had the best night's sleep in a long, long time. We will certainly be back and plan to make this an annual getaway for the two of us!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: MikeMather
Reviews.Content: I travelled there with my family for 5 nights from Sunday 7th August. The hotel was fairly quiet as this is low season due to the summer heat hence it was excellent value for money. The place based around an old villa built in the 1920's and extended and converted into a hotel in the late 90's.The place is understated and attention to detail is excellent. It has a really nice feel to it. All of the rooms are set around gardens and pools and you would not believe there are 120 rooms. The reception is tiny, so don't expect to be wowed by marble and chandeliers. It is like you are staying at somebodies home (all be it rather large!). I can't praise the staff and service at this hotel enough. Evan from the valet, Jose-Caro, Dustin and the others from the pool were fantastic and really treated you like royalty. Nothing was ever too much trouble and they constantly topped up iced water at the poolside meaning you were not forced to keep buying drinks. Overall, definitely the best place I have ever stayed and will definitely be returning and we have stayed in some high end hotels around the world. Old town Scottsdale is about 5 minutes in the car and downtown parking is free. That brings me on to resorts fee's. As we had two Valencia suites it was a total of $56 a day plus tax but this covered tips, paper, parking and wifi. If you factor it into the room price at booking it is not an issue. Try the T Cooks lounge. The bar food is excellent and the happy hour is 5-7pm and their was a reverse one later. We did not use the main T Cook restaurant but the locals in the lounge highly recommended it. Prices seemed ok compared to UK prices for similar standard fare. Finally the standard of the room was excellent with top end furnishings and spotlessly clean. The layout of the valencia was slightly unusual with the bath between the lounge and bedroom but it is a good layout if four are using the room as it can be segregated with two sliding doors.

Reviews.Title: “A must when visiting Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lifer23
Reviews.Content: Excellent service -- really wonderful to experience. Loved the food as well. Definitely try the buffet! Appreciated having TVs on all the fitness machines. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: HBS2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to Arizona resorts for the last fifteen years. We have been staying at Royal Palms for the last five summers. This resort always exceeds our expectations. There is no other place to stay! Perfection! Look forward every summer to being at Royal Palms. Always so sad to leave!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nrizk
Reviews.Content: Staff seem to have a genuine customer service orientation. Rooms, grounds, fitness centre and other common areas were all impeccable. Service was outstanding from beginning to end. Ranks as one of the best experiences we've ever had at a resort (including an excellent stay at the Four Seasons in Scottsdale on this holiday). The glowing reviews on TripAdvisor are well-deserved. Only negative was at the restaurant, T Cook's. We went for happy hour appetizers and drinks. The appetizers sounded good but didn't deliver. Very mediocre. Greasy really. Not a big deal as there are ample dining options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and relaxation in beautiful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: SelectTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in Phoenix. We had booked at the last minute and got a really good rate so we were a little dubious what the property would be like. It turned out to be fabulous. Immediately upon entering the hotel driveway, we felt transported into elegant Spanish environs. The valets welcomed us and efficiently took care of the rental car, the luggage and escorting us to the check-in desk which was really a quaint parlor-like room. From the efficient check-in to the initial tour of the resort, we we were thoroughly enchanted with the hotel and the service staff who were helpful and available at all times. The food and drinks were excellent and the restaurant ambiance was entirely consistent with the Spanish theme of the hotel. The outdoor seating area, including for the bar was absolutely enjoyable and peaceful. At night the bar had a couple of singers who provided live music to which those so inclined (like us!) could dance on the small bar room floor. The singing duo even took our requests and did their best to please. As did all the other staff at the resort, especially so at the pool. Already in March the temperatures were nudging the upper nineties and the staff kept running up an down making sure that the pool guests were supplied with endless glasses of lemon iced water. Our room was small and a bit oddly arranged. The bathroom was in between the bedroom and the sitting area (where the sofa sleeper was that my daughter slept on) so that all traffic needed to be through the bathroom. The room was also small and had a view on a small back alley. This was our only negative for the hotel. But then, it is an older property and we were not surprised by some quirkiness. The overall feeling of the property very much evokes a feeling of being in a rich, Mexican villa being attended to by smiling, friendly people. The worst part is that at some point you have to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent surprise. Tipless environment and dicreet luxury. pool amazing, place astounding.”
Reviews.Author: dejemage
Reviews.Content: Stay for more than one night. This is a resort type hotel. We came as a family of five and each of us was treated like princes and princesses.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Palm Resort & Spa is best way to experience Arizona for the first time.”
Reviews.Author: KevinDeLaMater
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Royal Palm was the best couples get-a-way we've experienced. Every person there tries to make your stay a memorable one. No detail was overlooked. Each room at the resort is as good as the next. The grounds are beautiful. T-Cooks was a terrific dining experience. The pool was relaxing, and the spa was second to none. We were pleased and plan to go back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort! I would recommend the Royal Palms to my friends and family.”
Reviews.Author: jleerosie
Reviews.Content: The staff is unbelievable... in a good way! Everything was clean and well kept. The food was awesome. You need to check this place out!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Luri69
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are very clean and romantic. The staff in the hotel gives excellent service. The pool is open 24 hours... T Cooks restaurant is the best I visited in Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, great food- we'd love to be back!”
Reviews.Author: Macjewels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a part of a Grand Canyon / Las Vegas trip. Our flight came into Phoenix and we rented a car and quickly arrived to the Royal Palms. We didn't want to drive to Sedona (out next day destination) at night. May I just say- good thing we didn't. The hotel really makes you feel as if you're somewhere else. Love the decor and the feel- we truly felt we were away. The staff right off the bat was hospital, pleasant and check-in at 8pm was easy. Room was clean and spacious- everything we would need was at our fingertips. Went to the bar for dinner and the bartender had some fantastic recommendations. Truly enjoyed our meal! Live music was a bonus! Next day breakfast was equally delicious at T. Cook's. Highly recommended food. Ambience in this place is fantastic, really romantic. We tried the pool and hot tub and it was very peaceful, silent. If you're looking for a retreat, this is it! There is a resort fee, but it does cover some extras like internet, parking, tips- although feel free to tip for above and beyond service. Another online deal we were very happy with! We certainly would love to be back.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite resorts in the valley”
Reviews.Author: cangirl44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Royal Palms Resort and Spa July 22-24. We stayed in a Montecito Terrace room. The accomodations were clean and lovely.....king sized bed, beautiful furnishings, a nice patio with an awe-inspiring view of Camelback mountain with swaying palms and a relaxing fountain. The staff was very accomodating and we felt very special.....everyone seemed happy we were there. T. Cooks restaurant, which is on the premises, has a luxurious atmosphere and the food was well prepared and plated. The bar is a lot of fun and has character. We would recommend this resort for a quiet weekend for couples. I don't think it would be a good choice for families as there isn't much to do on the grounds and the pool is very small. Romantic? Yes. Family- orientated? No.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Palms - Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: hockeywriter
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time at the Royal Palms in Scottsdale. Every time leaves me eager to return. The personal service and attentiveness are outstanding. Love the mostly adults atmosphere. It never seems crowded. Perfect for couples or mother/daughter get-away. Great food and Fashion Square Mall about 2 miles down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Royal Palms Resort and Spa is great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Prescott2007
Reviews.Content: Royal Palms is great place to stay. Staff is friendly and very helpful. As a returning guest, they acknowledge that fact and make one feel welcome. Property is relaxing and enjoyable. Easy to not want to leave as the place is very easy to like. Food is outstanding at T. Cooks so don't miss eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: sduarte35
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a night at the hotel. It's my favorite for a reason. The grounds are spectacular and the service is impeccable. The rooms are extremely comfortable and the views are amazing. It truly is a get away from very thing. T. Cook's has incredible food and the Sunday brunch is delicious and reasonably priced. We had a complimntary room at another hotel the nit after our stay and debated staying at the Royal Palms instead, but decided to check out the other hotel. We were only gone an hour and called back to see if they had an available room! The staff welcomed us back & they gave us a fabulously upgraded room. It means a lot when the staff greets you by name after only having met you once. I can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a couples get-away, best spa experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: abqtravelgal
Reviews.Content: Sometimes true quality and excellence shines through not only in what was perfect, which is just about everything here, but also in what wasn’t. The staff addressed very loud maintenance right outside our room at a very early hour efficiently and with grace. The term guest really does apply at this property. Some tips for enjoying this gorgeous and tranquil place: 1) If you like sitting on your room patio and soaking in a beautiful view, ask for Designer Casitas 109 or 110. 2) If you are into fitness, the resort has a guest agreement with the Village just about 5 minutes down Camelback. It is a fabulous facility with tons of classes. Try the Gentle Yoga. The fitness center at the resort is very small. 3) Get a spa treatment. This is the most serene spa I have ever been to. 4) Go in the summer. Stay a 3rd night for free. It’s really not that hot. 5) The resort is really much more appropriate for adults than kids.

Reviews.Title: “Superior resort, just not for gentlemen”
Reviews.Author: deredye
Reviews.Content: I agree with most post. This hotel is unique, beautiful etc. The attention to detail is amazing, and the service is incredible. However, it is definitely catered towards a more feminine clientele. I came to the hotel with my wife, and even she thought it was a little "overdone". The decor of Spanish/Country French/Island/Sonora Desert is confusing, although probably on purpose. Overall a unique luxury retreat, just not everyone's style.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: actressmom99
Reviews.Content: This is a special place - serene and lush property, wonderful staff and lovely rooms. Staff goes the extra mile when you make a request. The food at the restaurant is outstanding and very good value. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Serenity Now was my mantra for this much needed trip and that's what I received. Thanks all! I will return ASAP!”
Reviews.Author: trishrc
Reviews.Content: The spa was completely amazing. I felt solitude even though there were others receiving treatments. It was peaceful, calm and the staff (Lisa, Lisa Marie, Nicki and Sasha) was so professional and so good at what they do. I felt a kindness and caring from each team member (Wendy and Meagan's welcome). I melted into the furniture and experienced a peace and calm that I hadn't for years. Thank you to the whole team. I will be singing your praises to everyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Earth”
Reviews.Author: tatiana27
Reviews.Content: It's my first public review, usually have no time, no wish, etc. But this Hotel is something special , can't stand to say a few words. Really perfect in everything. And really calming atmosphere. If we plan someday to visit Arizona again, no doubt we'll stay only here. Highly recommended to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Experience!!! June 24-27, 2011”
Reviews.Author: PeJa61
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms Resort & Spa was absolutely fabulous! What more can I say,,, My daughter and I needed a quiet, relaxing, getaway from it all, this includes leaving the kids behind!! We are so glad we chose this manicured resort. Everything about this resort says Royal style,,,, From check-in to rooms, bell staff, spa, pool, gardens, restaurant>try the Pork<Yum, and the staff are so attentive and greet you by name!! We loved our time here and will go back for a longer stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: JodieBrownlee
Reviews.Content: It's a spanish style converted mansion and has all the trappings to make you feel like an honoured guest. Every little nook and secret courtyard was a masterpiecefrom the hand painted chests, to the fruit garden. Service was friendly and efficient. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and the staff waited on us hand and foot!”
Reviews.Author: efletch3
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a quick vacation with my wife and was greeted with helpful and friendly valet and reception staff. The bellboy helped us to our room and kept up friendly conversation as well as ensuring our room was stocked with some ice and too our liking. My wife enjoyed the Alvadora Spa while I investigated the grounds. They were beautifully maintained with lots of rabbits running around. We enjoyed the pool (it does get very cool after the sun goes down, even during June) and there is a cabana bar open from 11 to 6 and serves drinks and food. We were staying in one of the Valencia Casitas, which was a beautiful and spacious room equipped with a mini-bar, living room set, robes, safe, and vanity set. There are interconnecting doors between the Casitas, which are great for parties staying together, but unfortunately are not very sound proof. We had dinner at T.Cooks Restaraunt on the property and were pleased to learn that the head chef had competed on Iron Chef and the food was amazing. The later check-out time allowed us to sleep in and check out was as easy as check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Know What All the Fuss is About?!?”
Reviews.Author: Dalecorp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Palms for the Lamborghini Giro and was quite disappointed mainly because of high expectations. The room and service were both mediocre for a hotel of this caliber.... Returning to Scottsdale, I would definitely stay at Sanctuary or Hyatt Gainey Ranch which are both superior in every regard. The only bright spot to the stay was the food, both dinner and breakfast at T. Cooks. Otherwise, I certainly couldn't tell you why others regard this as the best hotel in Scottsdale - Maybe, they've never stayed in a Casita at Sanctuary?!?

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: AjSe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for our third anniversary and had a wonderful time. We highly recommend the Royal Palms as your home away from home. The staff was very welcoming and super friendly. The Lamborghini convention held at the resort this last weekend was amazing... We liked the 1200hp Bugatti Veyron that happened to be parked out front. Check out the picture below!

Reviews.Title: “You know it's a nice hotel when there's a Lamborghini convention there”
Reviews.Author: taw3210
Reviews.Content: What an awesome place! I've stayed at numerous high-end hotels/resorts. This is one of the most quaint and cozy resorts I've ever experienced. The staff was truly amazing in their friendliness and cheerful attitude. At some high-end spots, the staff puts off an arrogance that is irritating -- not here. The room was very spacious, well decorated. Nice to walk in with relaxing music playing and soft lighting. The bath was especially spacious. The concierge went out of her way to assist with golf arrangements. The number of high-end resorts in the Phoenix area is overwhelming, but this should be on the very short list of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit, Lining Up 3rd for Next Year”
Reviews.Author: JMoCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms is officially my favorite resort-aside from our fav. on the ocean in Los Cabos (no ocean in Phoenix- can't be helped). Yes, we have been to nicer, more "perfect" resorts- but the bottom line is the service, the grounds and the ambiance at the Palms keeps bringing us back. I said it before- if you can't relax and unwind here- you can't do it anywhere. Around every corner is a bench or garden or trickling fountain or hammock. Poolside staff re-fills your water (and drink order) constantly and the valet staff will remember your name- 1 year later. The rooms are lovely with attention to detail and romance. Yes the pool is too small. Yes there is a resort fee (plainly advertised). But that fee covers valet, gratuities, wireless, newspaper and twice daily room servicing. The pool is open 24 hours- go later and enjoy complete privacy. Its still 80 degrees out after dinner. Most telling to me- the number of Phoenix/Scottdale residents who "staycation" here. They don't go to the Biltmore or the Phoenician- when they want to feel like they are apart and away from the everyday world they go to the Palms. One note if you are deciding what room to book: the spa suites have a full bath, full living room and master bedroom. They are all divisible by large pocket doors. (Great for quiet time). They are modern and clean. The downside: they are in a standard hotel-type wing- which means you can have someone above you or below. If you want to be esconsed in total privacy- book a casita. The rooms aren't quite as nice, but they are very secluded. Its a personal preference. Get to the pool (early), grab a cocktail, have Matt prop up the umbrella to give you shade, and forget the world. (or grab a hammock under the palms and read a book, or watch the bunnies.) I am a full speed-type A-always moving-hotel snob with no patience and no tolerance- I forget it all here.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: AUKTourist
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms and Spa sets out to be the best in the area. It achieves this through a focus on customer service from all members of staff. Whenever an issue arises it is resolved without fuss. The rooms are serviced twice a day and are comfortable and clean. At the pool Jose and the team ensure that you are looked after even pampered throughout your stay. We were there 8 days and had no issues with finding somewhere to sunbathe, the pool team provide you with iced water throughout the day. A perfect gem of a place.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best!”
Reviews.Author: quicktraveler91
Reviews.Content: We had an incredible visit to this resort. We experienced a positive review even before getting to the hotel. We called in to Jim to see if we could have an earlier check-in the day before. He noted he would try and to contact him the next day. We did receive the early check-in as promised, and they were so helpful at the front desk. They took care of the boarding passes quickly and had the bellman take the luggage to our room. They also got ice for us at the same time. You do pay a resort fee for no tipping but trust me, you really get great service. The grounds are beautiful and also the rooms have been updated with beautiful soaking tubs, my wife enjoyed. The service at the pool was spot on, before you knew it, water arrived and was kept full without any requests. The restaurant was great and they went out of their way to be actually nice to you. The stay was comparable to the Bel-Air hotel which I rate as one of the best places to stay. You cannot go wrong here, yes, it is pricey but you get what you are expecting. I did interface with Jim during my stay and he was the most polite person I have met. Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Say Enough Good Things!”
Reviews.Author: Kara42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Palms in Scottsdale in May and just loved it! It may be the best hotel experience I've ever had, and that's saying a lot since we live and travel extensively in Europe. The Royal Palms treated us with outstanding customer service and it was obvious that their customers are their number one priority. We booked a casita for a couple of nights and it was roomy and very nicely appointed. The bed was also incredibly comfortable. The grounds are lush and beautiful, and our casita was extremely private and quiet. In the mornings, we had breakfast delivered and the food was excellent, like everything else about this hotel. It really was a perfect stay. When we checked out, the desk clerk asked if there was anything they could have done to improve upon our experience, and our honest answer was no.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: crosscreek7
Reviews.Content: Our stay was perfect. The staff was more than attentive, check in was easy--even though it was a bit crowded, ice tea and water were in the lobby. We arrived half an hour before check in, so we sat in the lovely courtyard and enjoyed our ice tea. The room was just lovely, and I highly recommend the restaurant--less pricey than I had anticipated-- and again, outstanding service, great food and wine. During this time of year, "shoulder season" and summer, look for special deals. The rates are considerably lower, but the quality is still excellent.
