From the General Manager to the housekeeping staff, they reflect care and consistently superb competence unparalleled at any other resort property. Working with colleagues of this quality makes it difficult to exceed expectaions, yet that is exactly what Rick and Jose, who man the poolside Cabana, have accomplished. They are gentlemen who view their service as a rewarding career rather than a way to pay the bills as you may find at other resorts. Even if you are particular, they are likely to anticipate your need before you do. They will mix a superb smoothie or cocktail inspired by your personal preferences and ensure your comfort while lounging poolside. On one occasion, Rick went to a store early in the morning before coming to work and purchased several decks of cards (his time, his $) to compile a pinochle deck for my husband and I because we had forgotten ours. They also perfectly concocted a special beverage for us based solely upon a distant memory. Jose tracked down my favorite pop within moments of my unique request. These are merely a few examples from our more recent stays. We never stay elsewhere because we know it would disappoint compared to our experiences here. Although the property and grounds are so exceptional that they themselves provide compelling reason to travel from any location to stay here, the staff transforms this exceptional resort into an incomprable destination. I admit I hesitate to share my unrestrained gushing (I have after all been coming here for more than a decade) because I do not want to ever see this propery change or expand, but I am compelled to honor the exceptional service we have received by sharing our experience. Indulge in a stay here and you are unlikely to have a single regret, other than having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place.”
Reviews.Author: 2BizzyTravlin
Reviews.Content: From the rooms to the grounds, this is an exceptionally beautiful resort with superb service. The meandering paths surrounded by beautiful foliage, fountains and benches provide a soothing, peaceful walk to your room. The rooms are quiet, well appointed and the beds are the most comfortable we've ever experienced away from home. This is a wonderful, peaceful, and romantic setting for couples. I would not stay here with children.

Reviews.Title: “By Far, the Best Hotel in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: baps27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got engaged here and married here, so this place is very special to us. In our opinion, this is an exceptional hotel. As soon as you check in, everyone on staff knows your name and calls you by name. I don't know how they do it. The rooms are nicely decorated - they don't feel hotel-y. Everything is spotlessly clean. All employees are there to serve and they do it very well. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We'll be staying there again this November. The food is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: aark
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Royal Palms we have enjoyed weddings and dinners at T. Cooks several times.The hotel was fantastic the rooms were most comfortable with old world charm. We stayed in casita 132 it was very private with a path that leads only to your casita with a private patio.The hotel has less than 200 rooms so they can give more individualized attention something you would expect from a 5 star resort. I would not recomend the resort for families as it is very adult oriented. If you are looking for the most amazing adult tranquil vacation this should be your first choice. Alvadora Spa was first rate. And T.Cooks the on site dining wonderful as always. My wife and I were so relaxed after our visit we wanted to take it home with us so we purchased the robes, CDs, and signature scent of neroli to our home to recreate the relaxation that we enjoyed

Reviews.Title: “absolutely beautiful setting and facility, great value off-season”
Reviews.Author: babette50
Reviews.Content: we needed to spend one night in phoenix and selected Royal Palms because of Trip Advisor comments. this is a really lovely hotel, spread out and private, lush landscaping, very comfy room with large bath and large walk in closet/dressing area, plus private garden patio. the staff was very welcoming and attentive. only problem was inability to obtain saturday night dinner reservation at a reasonable hour (i suspect they fill up with locals), so we opted for room service which - while pricey - was very delicious. poolside breakfast was mellow and a good value. we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Betsina
Reviews.Content: Orbitz had the Royal Palm suites on sale for $99, which was more than we wanted to pay as graduate students on a road trip, but we decided to splurge given the good deal it seemed to be. We had high expectations, but they were exceeded. The hotel is beautiful, the suites are comfortable, charming, and cozy. We didn't want to leave! We only stayed one night but we wished we had stayed longer. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very over rated!”
Reviews.Author: sarge1234
Reviews.Content: This resort is very over rated. When they take your credit card at check-in...ask them how much they take out for "incidentals"...they don't bother to tell you! Rooms are dark and somewhat dingy. We ate breakfast at T.J. Cooks restaurant, and the service was terrible. The waiter's acted like they were doing you a favor by waiting on you! And make sure you do not leave ANYTHING out for the room attendants to look through...or take!. We "lost" an item from our room during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed with this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer1907
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and quite unique, positioned in the shadow of camelback mountain. The gardens are simply beautiful, the rooms are boutique style, every one individual and beautifully decorated. We had a bungalow with a private patio in the front and a small walled courtyard in the back. The service was first rate throughout - nothing was too much trouble. for the team..US service at its absolute best. We decided to stay an extra couple of nights as we enjoyed our stay so much. The food by Chef Lee Hillson and his team was fabulous...T Cooks restaurant should not be missed and the breakfasts are to die for!! Great value, nice spa....we had a truly exceptional experience throughout and will definately go back. We looked to stay at the Sanctuary but thought it far too impersonal and too staged and the staff perfunctuary without the inituitive service we received at the Royal Palm. At the Royal Palm the team seemed to really enjoy any opportunity to make your stay memorable for all the right reasons. The only small criticism I have is that the pool is on the small side and so the sun lounge area is cramped at times - especially at the weekends. Other than that and it was not a show stopper it was a perfect stay...and we are tough critics!! Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: nycgirl8
Reviews.Content: I was only at the Royal Palms for one night. My cousin had her bat mitzvah here and it was just beautiful. Location, service, landscape...amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Resort”
Reviews.Author: kld8765
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the resort just for one night and wished we were there longer. The grounds are beautiful with the mountain view. The staff was great. Dining at T Cook was romantic and the food was great. If you want to be catered to, this is the place to stay. I cannot imagine anyone going here and having a bad stay, even if you do not interact with the staff the property is so romantic, beautiful and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to celebrate anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Saguaro2009
Reviews.Content: We booked online through the special summer rate, and were immediately enchanted with the landscaping, antiques, friendliness, and elegant yet home-style feel of this place. We would highly recommend the summer special to anyone looking for a quick getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Romantic”
Reviews.Author: ludiandrade
Reviews.Content: After receiving a special rate notice from Travel Ticker that offered this hotel at $90+ a night I was a little skeptical since this is more than 60% discounted so I consulted with my "travel friends" at Tripadvisor. Much to my surprise, this hotel was rated #1 in Phoenix by reviewers. And boy were they not wrong! This is a beautiful property located within luscious gardens of palms, flowers and gorgeous foilage! Unfortunately, we were not able to see flowers as it was 116 degrees. All trails lead to "casita" style accomodations. The property gives the feel of a luxury old fashioned mediterranean home (mansion) instead of a commercial type hotel. Upon our arrival, we were greeted by the excellent valet staff who took our luggage and escorted us to the front desk. The front desk staff was very very attentive to our every need. Check in was smooth and we were greeted with a "happy anniversary" - we were celebrating our 27th wedding anniversary. In addition, the hotel presented us with a gift platter of cheese and fruit for the occasion sent to our room. LOCATION: Location is great - it is actually a few blocks from The Phoenician and very close to Scottsdale. Malls, Restaurants, Nightlife and other entertainment. ROOM: We were assigned Casita #112 - no two casitas are alike so this review is based only on this casita. Although I booked this as a "designer" casita (at a higher than the "special $90" rate), after entering it mostly resembled a "southwestern" style casita. I didn't confirm this with the front desk as it was lovely anyway. The decor was of mediterranean and spanish style. Very comfy and well appointed bed (king) and two nice chairs with a table. A soft chair with ottoman was provided facing the TV and a mini-bar. The casita has a door leading to its own private courtyard in the back that is furnished with two chairs and a table surrounded by a small flower and plant garden. Very private. The room also has double french doors with plantation shutters leading to a front courtyard also furnished with patio furniture. In-room internet ethernet, two two-line telephones, LCD TV, clock radio with nice smoothing spa music cds, candles and matches, in-room coffee and tea are provided. Also provided is an iron, ironing table, shoe shining kit (although the hotel provides complimentary daily shoe shine) and daily paper. Minibar items are for purchase. Turn down service nightly. On our first night, we had a Rose Petal Heart placed on the bed upon turn down (this was ordered in advance). The bathroom is very large with a very very large shower. My only concern is the bathroom has no a/c vent - only a small window and a skylight that at 116 degree temperature this becomes intolerable to be in there. An exhaust is provided but does not do the job of removing the extreme heat. Blow dryer, lighted mirror , many towels, slippers, robe and shower amenities is provided. The shower gels, soaps and shampoos are all orange blossom oil based - wonderful! Bought a bottle of lotion at the spa to take home (@$22USD). DINING: Dined on Jul 19 at T.Cook's - the hotel restaurant - a fantastic experience. Very quiet and romantic atmosphere. Inside or outside patio choices - with the heat we chose inside. Our server, John, was excellent - tended to our every need. The food and dessert were of first class. We were a party of four each having, Ribs, Poulet Chicken, and Fish and lobster. Highly recommend the restaurant - reservations prior to hotel arrival is suggested. SPA: We had a couple's massage which was excellent. The spa facility is very beautiful. We did not use the pool as it was very hot during the day but found the poolside area as lovely as the rest of the property. PROBLEM: We did encounter problems with the housekeeping department. Our room was never cleaned unless we called and then we still waited for them to appear. We would leave our room around 10am and return on average about 3 to 3:30pm where we would find our room in the same condition it was left in. On the third evening we informed the front desk of this problem and experienced some difficulty with the front desk staff - Ms. Jennifer. She appeared not to know how to handle this complaint. When we requested to speak to the manager, she informed us that the manager was -conveniently for her - not available and a message would be relayed. We never heard from the manager that evening. The following morning upon check out we informed the front desk staff who immediately referred us to the front manager, Ms. Beth Friddle who quickly apologized for the lack of service of housekeeping and the behavior of Ms. Jennifer. Ms. Friddle is a professional at her job. This is the only problem we encountered at this establishment. OVERALL: For a wonderful romantic experience, I highly recommend this hotel with its majestic views, surroundings and fantastic staff! We certainly will be returning in the near future. Keep in mind that the hotel charges a $25 daily resort fee that includes valet parking. Cars are garage kept. I have posted some pictures for your viewing.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Phoenix/Scottsdale”
Reviews.Author: pastol
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 days in July. I thought long and hard about where to stay, having been to Phoenix before and stayed in both The Four Seasons and The Phoencian, the Four Seasons being the better by a mile. So I was slightly apprehensive about my choice, but I can honestly say it was outstanding, espeically the service. Our room which we got upgraded to was a Montavista Spa Suite, really large with stunning views of The Camelback Mountain. It had a large bathroom in the middle of a living room and bedroom unusual but it worked. It was all finished to an excellent standard. As I read in other reviews the pool was small, it was, although at this time of year you do get away with it, I wouldn't want it to be to busy as I think it would struggle, the service however at the pool was the best I've experienced anywhere including Dubai luxury resorts. The hotel is also in a great location for both Scottsdale and Phoenix, which really is just one big place. There's not much to choose between the Royal Palms or the Four Seasons but I would go for the Palms as the location is much more central. The only other place that rivals these resorts is Sanctuary on Camelback it is lovely but maybe a little to modern for my taste.The other resorts are just too large to be personal enough for me, as nice as they are. If you have booked the Royal Palms your in for a treat and im sure you will love the attention to detail where everybody goes the extra mile for you.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: tpw525
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms Resort & Spa was amazing! Its styled as a Spanish Casita and used to be the vacation home of a married couple in the 1930's. The history of the property is uniquely detailed as wall art. The service was exceptional. Housekeeping was meticulous and precise. For turndown service, our robes were laid at the edge of the bed, lights were dimmed and soft, instrumental Spanish played as we enter the room. The resort charges a $25/day "resort fee", which covers valet and bellman fees/tips. The room was a nice size....king size bed, Jacuzzi, walk-in shower and separate toilet area. The pool area was tucked right in the center of the property with wait staff ready to take your order or provide you with nicely chilled water with lemon. The property also featured a fitness center with room key entry….three treadmills, two elliptical machines and dumbbells with a weight bench. We didn't get a chance to experience the spa treatments, as this wasn't the purpose of our trip. The price list indicated higher prices Fri-Sun. The resort also features a fabulous restaurant called T. Cooks (named after the original owners). T. Cooks' service was enchanting and the food soared above all expectations. The "cherry on top" was the chef's dessert special.....caramel cheesecake crème brulee with guava puree. It was fantastic! The resort was about 15 minutes away from Phoenix Int'l Airport and close to grocery stores and other restaurants. The Grand Canyon is about 3.5hrs away. The resort offers day trips for about $150/person...the trips leave the resort at about 6:30am, returns about 8:30pm and includes several stops at various sightseeing points along the way. We rented a car and decided to drive up ourselves...the views were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: sdpfaff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 40th Wedding Anniversary and looking for a special place to stay for the week. We traveled to Phoenix from out of state not knowing what to expect, but hoping all of the rave reviews we read on Trip Advisor ahead of time were true. The property is breathtaking and the rooms are beautifully appointed! It is a wonderful and romantic place to spend a special occasion. There are fountains, fabulous flower gardens, and wonderful places to sit and enjoy the serenity of the place. On our first evening, we were surprised with a fabulous dessert assortment that was delivered to our room, in honor of our Anniversary compliments of the Staff! It was a wonderful and delicious surprise! We were blown away by the friendliness of the staff from the moment we arrived until we reluctantly left this morning for the airport. The Valet Staff took such good care of us, explaining where things were on the property, giving directions and advise on places to visit, as well as handing us cold bottles of water each time we left the property. The Pool Staff is over the top - serving bottomless glasses of ice water and making sure we were comfortable anytime we were at the pool! A special thanks to Jose for his great customer service and friendly smiles! We have never been treated as wonderfully anywhere (and we travel often). Everyone went over and above to make our stay very special. We are already planning our next trip to Royal Palms Resort! If you are looking for a very special place to spend your vacation, where you will feel pampered and taken care of - Royal Palms Resort is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Deakins
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, it was kind of odd that we couldn't just get the key and head to the room ourselves. We had to way for the bellman to come and take us to our room. When we got to our room it was a nice surprise we really enjoyed the look and feel of the room. As the night went on we decided to head out to the pool, but the pool was a little small for our taste, but the service at the pool was excellent. We got back to our room to shower and get dressed for dinner, when we heard a noise, that made the room shutter, didn't think anything of it, but it felt like a mini earthquake. When we got back from dinner the noise happened again, and for about every hour for the rest of night. Couldn't sleep and barely got any rest that night. The next night we had gone to the bar to get some hot tea when I told the bartender about the night before, he said he would hook us up with another room, that would be better than the one we were staying in. But when we got to our new room it wasn't better at all. It was a smaller and had a hotel room feel to it, where as the other room was a casita. I am not saying the hotel is bad, we just happen to have that kind of experience.

Reviews.Title: “A rare classic hideaway with gorgeous grounds and outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: Frqtrvlr09
Reviews.Content: Prior to my stay, I had eaten at the resort's restaurant, T. Cook's, on many occasions when in Phoenix, but I had never spend the night in one of its many types of accomodations. The prices seemed steep and I preferred the more discreet location and ambiance of its "sister" resort, the under-renovation Hermosa. However, I have rarely stayed in an accomodation anywhere in the United States, or elsewhere, that had the high quality of service at every level than the Royal Palms. From tthe minute I arrived by taxi from the airport, windblown and sand blasted after several days in chilly Flagstaff, when I was prfomptly and cordially met by the valets and escorted to the front desk, I felt special. In the cool, classy, intimate front office, I was quickly checked in, my advance request for newspapers had already been taken care of, my request for an early check in was accomodated, and my bags were promptly delivered to my Designer casita, which was atucked behind a wonderfully soft but not too sweet smeloling orange tree and trellises of fuscias. A smal table and chairs, at which I ate the delicious breakfasts delivered to my room, daily; read my papers; and stared up at the black sky and clear stars, in the evening. It was not fronting Camelback drive and the neighbors on the other side of the wall were accoodating,k so it was extremely quiet. I also stayed in a Valencia room which was similarly quiet ad a bit larger. The bathrooms are large and the beds are very comfortable. The meals are delicious, and room service is prompt and done with a lot of class. The grounds are simply gorgeous. FLowers, trees, green grass. Lots of places to just sit and look at the stars, fountains, read, or close your eyes. It is quiet, romantic, adn utterly peaceful. The spa, which has been recently renovated, is unique. Many of the treatments are done outdoors, in total privacy. There are outdoor jacuzzis set in stone and steam baths. My spa treatments were wonderful and the technicians were very professional. There is a large unheated swimming pool and an adjacent heated spa, and that was my only real source of unhappiness. SMoking is allowed at the pool, and it was annoying and fairly constant. While a couple of cigar smokers were required to do their puffing across the pool in cabanas, the smoke did waft its way across. THe bar/dining area at the pool can get very noisy as the sound carries, and much of the talking is by the pool attendants/ waiters. They were generally very good about constantly providing free iced water to guests and fairlyl regularly making rounds to see if anyone wanted food or drinks but sometimes they would just disappear for long stretches, or carry on long, and loud, conversations with certain guests. Another problem was allowing very young children in the jacuzzi. They were loud, and also used it as a swimming pool. The most annoying occurrence at the pool, which was constant, was the use of cell pjhones. They should be banned. For a place that is otherwise offering total rest and relaxation, it is simply not possible at the pool, with phones constantly going off and people of all nationalities shouting to whomever was on the other end. The restaurant is also loud when it is full. The acoustics are bad, and woe to you if you are seated next to a table of four or more, especially if they are heavy drinkers, and, particularly if they are a group of businessmen, and that was a frequent occurrence. Therewere three of us, and we practically had to shout to hear each other. I recommend you eat outdoors on one of the patios, which are heated on chilly desert evenings. Back to the valets, they were very quick to call cabs or limos, suggest alternate modes of transportation, including even, when possible, driving me to a destination themselves. They quickly and professionally greet dinner or other guests, including mine, and park and retrieve cars better than I've ever experienced. They are polite, humerous, well dressed, and knowledgeable about the area. In short, they make a great foirst and last impression. The business center is open twenty four hours a day, which is very convenient for those wh are working (or at least communicating) in different time zones. There is a small fitness center as well. The Royal Palms is now be my "go to" place in Arizona, if not anywhere in the US, for a relaxing vacation destination that also has many activites nearby if rest and relaxation isn't enough, such as hiking, golf, art museums, botanical gardens, spring training baseball games , and, downtown, professional sporting and cultural venues. High quality shopping and gourmet restaurants are also within a few minutes' drive. If you want to feel very special and be treated in a classy yet low key manner by professionals at their bvest, go to the Royal Palms. I've dreamed of going back for the past several months, and I just made a reservation for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Cloistered Slice of 5-Star Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Diegodad2
Reviews.Content: When I realized the conference I had to attend was in Scottsdale, I hoped I might be able to stay at the Royal Palms. Having attended weddings and eaten in the restaurant before, I hoped to add a guest room visit to my future. Let me just say, this hotel did not disappoint. When we drove in Evan, the valet/bellperson, was fantastic. While he unloaded the bags, another valet cleaned out the back seat of our car, throwing away cups and the flotsam and jetsum of a long car trip. Impressive, I thought. Evan escorted us to the Front Desk where we were checked in swiftly and it was off to our rooms with our escort leading the way. We wound through fountain-seranaded courtyards and colonades covered with bright bouganvilla. At every terminus of a walkway, we seemed to encounter enchanted private gardens or outdoor art. Later, we would wander through the hotel grounds, or rather explore the intimate gardens and fireplaces one finds in the most out of the way places. It gives the hotel a personal charm, a sense of privacy and enchantment that seemed to make (almost) irrelevant the 111 degree temperatures. The room was dark and cool in feel, a nice respite from the blaring heat outside. The bathroom included a 6 foot, fairly deep soaking tub and a tile enclosed shower. One note of improvement might be the bath towels that should probably include a bath sheet, but everything else, from the robes to the beautifully scented amenities, from the flat screen TV to the extensive magazine selection, the free wireless Internet and the luxurious linens, made for a comfortable, serene several nights of meetings. TCooks was great, too, although we only had breakfast there! Still, the superstars to me were the grounds and the staff. People like James, the minibar attendant that escorted us to the dining room when we were wandering, a bit lost, in our exploration of the hotel or Adam, the bell person who checked us out and noticed the computer bag, thoughtfully storing it in the bell closet to keep the equipment cool. It's the anticipation of needs and the attention to detail of the team that makes the Royal Palms experience live up to it's beautiful ambiance. Stay here, you will be so very glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Beautiful Property--Still A Little Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: BigBrion
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful hotels at which we have ever stayed. The grounds are gorgeous. Our room was very nicely decorated and furnished--just lovely. The service ranks up there with the greatest hotels of the world--especially the poolside service which is beyond compare. There was always a fresh of cold ice water at my side without even having to ask. The small ( and I stress small) areas for improvement are that they really need an adults only pool since the current pool area had quite a few noisy children. I do not understand what causes parents to bring young children to a romantic resort like this but there were times when their screaching and splashing in the pool took away from what otherwise would have been a positively idyllic experience. There were a couple well-behaved children but there were also some over whom their parents exercised less control. I think that this hotel advertises itself more as an adult-style couples' property than a family resort but it seemed to be more of an family property. A simple solution would be to place an adults only pool area in the Montecito Terrace courtyard, where the fountain now is. The other area for improvement is in the food. We had dinner in the restaurant on the property. The dining room is beautiful but the cuisine did not quite measure up to the beauty of the dining room. The cuisine was not bad...it just was not stellar like the rest of this property and the service is. All in all though, this is a wonderful place and you should not hesitate to stay there--just remember that some customers may insist on bringing their children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: perryfamilyAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to celebrate our anniversary. This is a historic hotel full of beauty and romance. The staff was great and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic resort”
Reviews.Author: sainttlouistravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our last night in Phoenix. The atmosphere of this hotel was very romantic. It doesn't even seem like you're in a large city once you enter the grounds of this hotel. Every part of this hotel is well manicured and has a wonderful European feel to it. Our room was extremely comfortable and I loved the shower. They had wonderful pancakes at their restaurant which I would highly recommend. We only had breakfast there, but apparently it is one of the most romantic places to have dinner. The only thing I was a bit annoyed about was the valet service. After a long drive from northern Arizona, we pulled up and were bombarded with overly eager valet people. I wanted to take my time gathering my things and stretching my legs but they stood there waiting for us to unload. I wish we could have parked ourselves and taken our time but they won't let you park your own car here. Also, be aware that they have a resort fee on top of your normal nightly fee. The resort fee covers all gratuity (valet people included) so that you don't have to tip if you're not inclined. Overall, this is a nice hotel but I think I enjoyed the Firesky Resort and Spa a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, romantic, relaxing with stellar service”
Reviews.Author: SamiGA
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Royal Palms for those seeking romance &/or relaxation but not for families. It's 20 mins from the airport & 5 mins from Scottsdale. The resort deserves the many accolades & awards it has received and it's worth & the cost. Stayed there for 4 nights with 2 girlfriends. From the moment we arrived to checking out, we received outstanding service. The grounds are beautiful everywhere you look. We stayed in a Valencia suite & the room was spacious, clean & quiet. Spa services were great & relaxing. Guests have free access to the steam room during their stay. Fitness room was small but always available & clean. Although we didn't use the pool, it was small & always busy. The restaurant, T Cooke's, is phenomenal! We dined there for breakfast & twice for dinner. The concierge & reception was very friendly, professional & accomodating. Ashley at reception was fantastic when our tour to the Grand Canyon was accidentally booked for the wrong date by the tour co & resolved the issue quickly. Concierge was helpful in calling taxis & even drove us to & from the Desert Botanical Gardens. Watch out for the 18% gratuity charge automatically added to room service & at the spa. Also, make sure you know the address of the hotel & anywhere you're heading because every taxi driver we had seemed oblivious. Maybe just our bad luck...?

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: moyo
Reviews.Content: Sadly delays caused by BA along with lost luggage cut our stay in half at this beautiful resort. But the staff were very helpful ringing the airport etc to help. Our room did not have an outside area, which was a little disappointing at first, but it was spacious and very nicely presented with the most comfortable bed ever ! The food was exceptional as was the service, the pool guy was so friendly and attentive, always serving iced water and arranging sun shades, even found us some sunblock, as ours was in the lost case. The valet guys also deserve a mention, so fast and efficient and always so friendly. Coming from the UK, everyone in Arizona was super friendly and approachable , which is so refreshing, we are not used to such genuine hospitality. Would highly recommend the resort, for relaxing times in a stunning setting.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: VTTravlr
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just spent 5 wonderful days here. From the time we drove in until we had to leave it was spectacular. The staff goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable & to meet your every need. The grounds are beautiful & our room was just what we resevered. We requested one of the individual casita's & we were not disappointed. It is a perfect place for a romantic getaway. I would not reccomend this for family's or children. The restaurant, T Cooks, was excellant! The only negative is the small pool & the area around the pool. Get a chair early to enjoy the pool. I will stay here on my next trip to Phoenix. Easy to get to from the airport, maybe 20 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Resort for a Romantic Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: JointAdventure
Reviews.Content: When it snowed the first week of April in Seattle, my husband and I decided we needed some sun. We just spent the past Easter weekend at the Royal Palms Resort and Spa in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. It was the perfect small resort for our last minute romantic get away. It was the first time we have been to the Royal Palms and there were quite a few room style choices. We went with a package featured on their website that included a third night free when you booked two nights. The package also included $50 toward food and beverage in T. Cooks (their fine dining restaurant) and $50 toward spa services. We upgraded for an additional $10/night to be in the "Designer Casita." We were in "Casita" 116 which isn't really a casita as it is attached on both sides to another casita but the room was very private and it had its own front patio and was situated in a cul-de-sac of casitas. There was some street traffic noise from E. Camelback Road as these rooms are in the front of the hotel but once inside the room, we didn't hear the traffic once. The room was very tastefully decorated in a Mediterranean/colonial style. It was painted in a rich dark color which we found cozy but someone else might find oppressive. There was a gas fireplace (with remote.) The flat screen TV was in an armoire and was a bit small for the distance it was from the bed but there were two very comfortable chairs at the end of the bed which worked well for viewing. The room had a nice size desk, a large closet and ample drawer space. The four poster king bed was very comfortable with nice linens. There was turn down service each night. The bathroom had a large walk in shower with a skylight and a separate standard tub. The amenites were lovely. I couldn't get enough of the orange blossom scented moisturizer. (I bought a large bottle at the spa to take home.) The resort is very atmospheric and the grounds are lovely with flowering plants, meandering walkways. and pools and fountains. You really feel like you have gotten away. The swimming pool area is small and the lounge chairs would fill up each day but the staff was very accomodating setting up more seating as needed, refreshing used towels, providing ice water, adjusting umbrellas and serving light food. The pool water wasn't heated and it was too cold for me to enjoy at this time of year but my husband braved it and enjoyed floating on the "rafts" provided. The fish tacos at the Cabana Cafe were excellent. We ordered room service a number of times and were quite impressed. In room dining is one of the most difficult services for a hotel to get right but the Royal Palms didn't disappoint. They were extremely timely and efficient. They accomodated all of our little requests for things off the menu (peanut butter for my husband's toast, cottage cheese for me.) Kudos to server/manager Todd for a great job/department. (If I had one suggestion, it would be to warm the breakfast bakeries but that is a small fine point.) We enjoyed our two dinners at T. Cooks restaurant. (A little disappointed with the desserts but the ice cream and sorbet were worth the calories.) Sunday through Thursday they were offering three courses for $50 which was a good deal. We would highly recommend the roasted chicken, the salmon and the duck. One night we had dinner in the lounge. We shared a wonderful burger with a nice salad the night we arrived. There was live music and a great relaxed vibe. Kim, our waitress, was very thoughtful to have the kitchen split our meal onto two plates and load up on the greens. We used the small but adequate work out room. The equipment was new (three treadmills with built-in TVs - head phones provided, I-pod adaptable, three oscillators) and there was a set of free weights, a small area for mat work and some yoga and "ball" equipment. I got lucky and didn't have to wait for a machine but I could imagine a line up. There was a hot tub by the pool which I didn't use because I over-heard the temperature was rather low. We did have massages in the new spa which was very nice. I am sorry that I forget the therapist's name because I would recomment her. My husband was pleased enough with his treatment too. Again there was a worthwhile package that included dinner for two in the restaurant when you booked two massages. Another deal Sunday through Thursday was a ninety minute massage for the price of sixty minutes. Not bad! The spa facility is new. It is small but thoughtfully designed with separate lounging areas (indoors and out) hottubs and steam rooms. The resort is showing some wear around the edges (i.e. lounge chair cushions, awnings in the cabana cafe) but the staff''s eargerness to please and atttention to detail make up for anything that isn't sparkling. The "resort fee" of $25/day was a little confusing. As I understand it takes care of housekeeping and valet but not any food and beverage service or pool attendants. Obviously we were very pleased with our first stay and plan to return. With the special packages, we felt we got a fair value. I think we got lucky because of these deals and am not sure what next year will bring. (We wouldn't return this year because I couldn't stand the intense heat later this spring/summer.) I understand these prices aren't usual. - All in all, it was just what the doctor ordered even though it did pour rain on Saturday and it was suggested that we had brought it with us...

Reviews.Title: “Best service I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: zipandlucy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I just spent a wonderful weekend here, and we didn't have a single complaint. Everyone was friendly and helpful. From the moment we sat at the pool, we had an ice water and menu. Our every need was anticipated from the bellman to the pool staff. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven at Camelback Mountain”
Reviews.Author: krispeykremen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a little getaway for our wedding anniversary, and normally we go to The Phoenician or Hyatt at Gainey Ranch which are both nice resorts. But we wanted to try Royal Palms this time.. Excellent choice! We arrived when the citrus trees in Scottsdale were blooming and the smell of orange blossoms just filled the air everywhere you went..at the RP's they have so many blooming trees it was like a botanical garden. When we checked in we were upgraded to one of the Monte Vista rooms and I think we got the best one! On the top floor facing Camelback Mountain and the pool and our room had two terraces.. We had room service one morning on one of them and it was so relaxing and the food was good. One thing I noticed about the room service is that is was less expensive than the other two resorts I mentioned and better food and service. The first night we were there we sat outside of T Cooks on one of the tables surrounding the fountain.. Beautiful night and weather and big candles at each table. We just had cocktails and lots of appetizers..very romantic setting.. On our second night we ate at T Cooks indoors and had one of the best meals ever.. One of the days we went out to the pool before noon, and I do suggest if you are planning on enjoying the pool area get there around that time as it gets very crowded. I liked how the minute I sat down a pool attendant came rushing up with a glass of iced water with lemon, and continued to refill every time it got empty.. It wasn't a very hot day to Arizona's standards but toasty enough to have to take a swim in the non-heated pool to cool off. Yes, the pool is not heated and it's oh so cold when you first get in, but I bet when the weather is 100+ it's a relief. We definitely plan on returning sometime this year, I think we'd like to try one of the Designer Casita's though just to get an idea on how the other rooms are..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds; nice rooms; service needs polish.”
Reviews.Author: jctdist2
Reviews.Content: We zipped off to Arizona at the last moment to celebrate my birthday. We chose the Royal Palms based on Trip Advisor reviews and on the RP's other reviews and rewards etc. The Royal Palms is lovely and very serene. However, though we were greeted nicely both upon arrival and at the pool with ice waters with lemon~service fell short in all areas. Excellent service is key for us; overall it was adequate; but again, not fabulous~as we would expect from a place of this calibar. Examples: ~Cleaning person did not clean any of the mirrors which were noticably splashed and one had an obvious and huge lotion mark from me stepping into it with my just lotioned arm. Also; a "gloop" of cleaning fluid was left on the bathroom floor. ~When we called for our car to go out to dinner it was waiting for us, BUT, even though there were two valets attending to one man in front of us, not one valet came to check on us...or even check if we were the party that belonged to the car~we just got in and drove off and could have been stealing the car for all they knew. ~Poolside~the waiters are very friendly, however, they do not come around often enough AT ALL...and it was NOT busy or crowded. ~Cook's Restaurant: food was good, BUT, again service-for lunch, brunch and dinner (we tried it three times) --was slow and spotty and it was NOT busy or crowded. .(which I don't abide as an excuse anyway). Is the resort beautiful? Yes and I believe we would try it again for a quiet romantic trip. However, service needs polish.

Reviews.Title: “A dream spot for the best romantic escape”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travelwith4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this fabulous boutique hotel and it was the best service I have ever experienced. Our room was upgraded to a Casita on arrival for a minimal amount. We had our own little bungalow with a front and back patio area. The back one had the utmost privacy 10 feet walls...The grounds were beautiful with flowers and fountains. Jose at the pool was always there to fill your water glas or get you whatever was needed. Breakfast pool side or at TJ cook was beyond great, we never really needed to eat away from the hotel! it is our intent to go back for our 10 year anniversary and I am so excited a year and a half to go and we will be back in paradise! The spa had outdoor hot tubs and doors which were opened to the outside during the treatments what a beautiful place....

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for our 20th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Elitefreak
Reviews.Content: A belated review of our amazing stay at the Royal Palms. The property is spectacular; architecture and flora make it picture perfect. We booked the Alvadora Spa suite - and it was absolutely perfect. Very atmospheric design, very romantic, and we loved the patio with large padded rocker to sit outside and watch the foutains and fire pits (or the view of Camelback) while having breakfast al fresco. T Cook's prepared a great dinner and breakfast for us - the ingredients were all top notch. The pool, although small, has a ton of atmosphere and is in a beautiful setting. Spa treatment was great. The only negative was an expectation based on heavy research that the Alvadora Spa Suites had several special amenities, including a personal in-room mini-massage every evening. The staff explained that it didn't work for most guests (hard to schedule) and they made amends for our disappointment with a few extras thrown in. You will love the Royal Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Yet”
Reviews.Author: CSBSC
Reviews.Content: I took 8 business owners and their spouses here for a retreat. I spent 3 nights, most of them were at the Royal Palms for two nights. I have been taking this group to hotels in CA, AZ and NV since 2001 and this is the best one yet. The rooms were excellent, spacious, clean. The meeting rooms were nice, opening up to patios with gardens and fountains. The restaurant and bar accomodated us with outstanding service. The catered food was wonderful. The valet staff knew us by name! The staff helped out out for golf, getting extras into the guest rooms, and the service was the best. Would I come here again? Yes. Would I recommend this venue for adults? Yes. Am I sorry my wife could not attend with me to experience the service, food, room and the atmosphere? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Charming getaway”
Reviews.Author: A36traveler
Reviews.Content: We chose Royal Palms because we were looking for something centrally located in Phoenix, yet we still wanted a place with some historical significance and charm. We were very pleased with our stay, however I would recommend asking to stay in one of the newer rooms as ours could have used a bit of a touch up (old bathroom, stains on the carpet, old windows which made the room somewhat dim). The highlight of our stay was T. Cooks, the signature restaurant on the property. The food and service was outstanding. Unfortunately we left on a sour note as we were overcharged on our bill at checkout. We would come back again, but would be sure to upgrade our room and double check our bill upon departure!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: RSBJGB
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a weekend stay at RP. Overall, the resort is a beautiful, superbly run property that I highly recommend for couples or business travelers. First of all, the location couldn't be better. It is relatively close to the airport (15-20 mins), centrally located near Phx and Scottsdale, and has beautiful views of adjacent Camelback Mountain. The property structures are very attractive, hacienda style (see website) and the grounds are perfectly maintained. It has a nice, serviceable pool, although its not the strong point. I stayed in a Montivista room, which was huge, well appointed and had a bed worthy of hiberating in. All of these great qualities aside, I was most impressed by the service, across the board. Everyone I encountered did an excellent job - valet parkers, desk clerks, TCooks servers/bartenders, housekeeping, etc. The service was on par, maybe surpassing, service I've had at Ritz's and Four Seasons. When there are many fine places to stay, as there are in Phx/Scottsdale, excellent service really makes a property stand out. They're doing a great job at RP.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ccbg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Palms for 2 nights on a trip to Arizona to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. What an exceptional experience and worth every penny! Every staff member we encountered spoke to us and most called us by name and congratulated us on our anniversary. Our room was unbelievably beautiful and opened on to a courtyard area with gorgeous landscaping, a reflection pool and fire pits which were lit each night. We had dinner one night at T. Cook's and it was one of the nicest meals we have ever had. The breakfast we had the following morning was quite good, as well. We would definitely recommend the resort to others and hope to return ourselves some day!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: itsourvacation2
Reviews.Content: Highlights: - Resort grounds are a private oasis from the city of Phoenix. - Staff is outstanding - Spa is the best we've experienced - ever - Food and drinks at T. Cooks and the pool bar are top notch This is our 3rd trip to The Royal Palms, and we couldn't be more pleased. I can't express how incredible the spa staff is. We've tried massages, facials, body wraps, manicures and pedicures and have been thrilled with every one of them. The staff at the pool (Rick and Jose) make everyone feel like family. We loved the bed so much we bought the mattress for our bedroom! Of all the places we've been, we'd recommend this most highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: BadgerFan_in_MN
Reviews.Content: The hotel was magnificent and we had great service. Our room was not ready when we arrived, but they held our luggage and called us when it was set, for we headed out for a while. It was a lovely room with a great view of Camelback Mountain. The orange trees surrounding our room were great and having a private patio was fantastic. The pool was small, but served its purpose of cooling us off and giving us time to relax. The Spa is out of this world. Our 60 min. couples massage was great, expensive but fabulous. T. Cook's restarant was out of this world. The combination of flavors and presentation was beyond words!! Checking out their website was the best bet of all, I was able to see their specials and was able to get one night free! Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in, luxury, relaxation and beauty surrounds everything at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth all the praise...”
Reviews.Author: nushball
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a romantic getaway after reading all the fabulous reviews on trip advisor. However, the visit was not half of what I expected. I booked one of the casita rooms, and while the bathroom was excellent, the rest of the room was dark, dusty, and not particularly appealing. To make things worse, there were black bugs all over the room (rolipolis – I am not sure if they have a more technical name). The night we checked in there was nothing we could do about it except hope for the best. The second night the staff sprayed the room – however the bugs remained and they had to come back in the next few days as well – not what I would expect from such a pricey and well-rated venue. Nothing was done to compensate us for this continuously unpleasant experience. Additionally, the reception staff and restaurant wait staff, as mentioned by another reviewer, was not particularly friendly or helpful. They did not recommend restaurants, excursion trips, or anything that would be useful for one’s first visit to Pheonix. We were also charged $70 for minibar items that we did not use. I had to call the hotel once I saw my credit card bill to have the charges reversed. To be honest, the only service I was really happy with was the valet service. The pool was ok ay– small and felt more like a backyard pool than one of a hotel resort. The rest of the grounds are very lovely – nice flowers and architecture. But other than that I found nothing exceptional or redeeming about the Royal Palsm. There are many amazing hotel options in Pheonix, when I return it will definitely not be to this venue.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Palms is a rare gem”
Reviews.Author: jadenyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this charming resort earlier this week. Having read the previous posts by other travellers we did have high expectations, all of which were exceeded. The Spanish/Moorish designed space was full of "hidden" spots for enjoying the mountain views or stolen kisses. Fire pits with cozy cushions made it delightful to sit outside and enjoy the beautiful views and weather in the evening. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner at T Cooks one evening. Another evening we ventured out to the Barrio Cafe for authentic Mexican food- the best I have ever had (8 minute taxi ride). Highy recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Oasis”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaArcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and it was quite lovely. Bougainvillea and hibiscus; beamed ceilings and Spanish tile; lots of beautiful birds and nooks and crannies. We had a spa suite which looked out to a private courtyard with an outdoor fireplace. The hotel bar is charming and the dinner we had at TCooks was excellent. Try the paella. I had a fantastic Watsu treatment at the Spa and would highly recommend it. The entire staff was warm and friendly, not stiff and formal. However, they seemed frazzled the day we checked out as there was a large group checking in. I called the front desk to ask for an extra hour to check out and was curtly told they were not allowing any late check outs that day. I just thought it might have been handled a bit better. Still, a lovely respite in the middle of the desert. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Lean22
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, winding, quaint property with flowers everywhere~ Attentive staff and excellent food! We would definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking!”
Reviews.Author: finetraveler0
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed an amazing weekend at the Royal Palms. This place is magical. The grounds, the wonderful Alvadora spa, T. Cook's, pool area, etc.- all amazing! I couldn't imagine staying any where else in the area, but the Royal Palm. I hope this place made the cut for Conde Nast & Travel & Leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a 40's movie star!”
Reviews.Author: snivvy
Reviews.Content: Hubby was on a business trip to Phoenix and we wanted to spend a few days together for our anniversary. We picked this hotel thanks to Trip Advisor and it was wonderful. The staff was attentive and charming, the property was intimate and private. Movie stars from the 40's and 50's used to escape Hollywood and stay at this very property. The atmosphere was old world hacienda with soft music playing, plenty of flowers and delicious iced tea in the lobby. We attended a special James Beard gourmet dining experience that was as elegant as any NY restaurant. Our tablemates couldn't have been more charming, gracious and fun. Our room was ample, offered a 2 person soaking tub, soft bed and plenty of air conditioning. Our biggest complaint was the hot weather, which wasn't the fault of the hotel. The property was conveniently located to major roads, not far from Scottsdale. We would definitely return to Royal Palms.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the desert”
Reviews.Author: beachloverPrinceton
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Royal Palms and loved every minute of it. Our only regret is that we didn't stay longer...The resort grounds are breathtaking and very romantic, landscaped with antiques and wonderful vegetation and the rooms (we stayed in the montavista suites) are amazing. We dined at T Cook and had a great dinner and also used the Alvadora Spa, which is the essence of relaxation. Throughout the resort the service is outstanding. We highly recommend the resort, a secret hideway in the desert...

Reviews.Title: “Great but strange room”
Reviews.Author: saintjack
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds and public space is beautiful...very nice to walk around or sit in the evening by a fountain and have a drink. The food absolutely outstanding...be sure to try the Mediterranean eggs for breakfast, a variation on Eggs Benedict. However, we stayed in a suite in the spa section that was expensive and strange: a small living room with an uncomfortable couch...then a bathroom area and then the small bedroom area. No feeling for spacious or comfortable...and the lighting was poor in all the rooms...could not read in bed...light over bathroom mirror off placed so had to lean in to get any light...same in living area. When mentioned this as checked out, the response was...suite designed to be intimate and cosy...next time you should stay in the larger suite. Conclusion: wonderful, but choose and check rooms carefully.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Douglas63
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms Resort and Spa is a wonderful place to relax. The backdrop of Camelback Mountain is breath taking. The rooms are nicely done. The service, from the valet to the pool attendant, was great. I didn't eat a meal at the resort because I didn't like the menu choices. Every restuarant that you have ever heard of has a franchise or two in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area so finding a good meal isn't a problem. I could receive the wi-fi signal from my room but i'm not sure if everyone can.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully relaxing with great service”
Reviews.Author: AndrewWoodworth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to visit Phoenix to get a break from the humidity where we live. After much research, we settled on the Royal Palms. We were not disappointed. On arrival, the valet staff were cheery and helpful, even offering to run small errands for us, such as a trip to the corner store, etc. The check-in process was smooth and the gentleman helping us with our bags was well informed about the resort's features, history, and amenities. The property is lush and well planted - a tropical oasis in the middle of the dessert. Beautiful. The rooms were clean, warm and inviting. The view of Camelback Mountain from our room was very romantic. The housekeeping staff were very thorough and the nightly turn-down service was a nice touch. I was suffering from a cold so we decided to stay in one evening. My wife ordered room service and when the wait staff arrived and noticed the cough syrup on the table, he showed genuine concern, explaining that the Royal Palms took illness very seriously and he would be happy to have the chef prepare some chicken soup and a hot toddy. Caring and attentive service was found throughout the property, with the pool attendants offering the best service. They were always ready to fill a drink, bring a glass of water, find a chair, refresh towels, etc. The pool bar closes a little early (6pm?) but the pool and hot-tub remain open all night. Great relief from the heat. The pool area was basically adults only. There was an occassional kid, but I got the impression children weren't encouraged. In fact, I overheard one of the valet's radio the pool attendant to let him know that "Shamu" had arrived (a family with an inflatable whale). They put a stop to that and we never did see Shamu or the kids. The restaurant was exceptionally good, although I did have one negative experience when I chose to sit outside to eat. We sat for about ten minutes and never did see any wait staff, even though the maitre'd assured us there was service on the patio. To be fair, it was very hot and nobody in their right mind would want to be outside and I was sick and didn't wait very long before leaving to head to our room. The lounge, adjacent to the restaurant had a great selection of drinks, a funky vibe, and great entertainment. It was hard to find a seat, but once seated the service was very attentive. My wife and I both had spa treatments while we were there. The spa was nothing spectacular, but very comfortable. Noticing I had a terrible cough, the masseuse even took the time to call me the next day to give me the name of a cough syrup his doctor had recommended to him. I noticed that some travellers complained about the $22 per day resort fee. This fee includes valet parking and all tips. It is a bargain - you would spend that much on valet in most hotels. Speaking of valet, if you call ahead before leaving your room, the valets will have your car ready and waiting with the air conditioner on. I fell in love with the place and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Spacemonkey5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful holiday touring Arizona, Nevada and Utah and the Royal Palms Resort and Spa provided the neccessary calm and tranquility in an otherwise hectic schedule. The suite was large large and beautifully appointed and all of the staff went out of their way to be helpful and welcoming. Although the temperature was 114 degrees, the pool was open 24 hours and provided a relaxing way to cool off. The food was excellent, as was the live music in the lounge. The gardens were beautiful, the Camelback Mountain provided a dramatic backdrop and the hotel was exceptional. More like staying with rich relatives in sunnier climes than staying in a hotel (If only I had some).

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: JJFuller
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked our trip to Arizona on a whim, acutally - after a few too many glasses of wine one night. We had never stayed at the Royal Palms but after finding a great packaged deal and reading how highly rated the hotel is, we decided to take advantage. (Not until the next day did we realize we'd be going in the scorching summer heat). Despite that, what a FANTASTIC trip!!! I have nothing but excellent things to say about the Royal Palms. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, the grounds are unlike any I've ever seen, and the rooms were comfortable and private. There was such attention to detail from the minute we arrived. Really, the privacy, service, atmosphere and detail are more along the lines of a top notch b&b than a hotel. Valet parking is included with your stay, which is very nice. If you do book through a site like Travelocity, note there is a $22 per night fee for gratuity, so there will be some extra expense involved once you arrive. The pool does look a little small, but we found that it was definately enough room for the amount of guests. I would highly recommend the Royal Palms!

Reviews.Title: “Pefect getaway for worn-out moms”
Reviews.Author: misty01lh
Reviews.Content: A friend & I recently stayed for 3 nights at the Royal Palms. All I can say to sum it up is "WOW". Once you pull up into the courtyard, you feel like you are transported into another world. Aside from the immaculate service and lush, impeccable grounds, the vibe is the ultimate in laid-back luxury. Trust me, you will not have to lift a finger while you are there. We went into Old Town Scottsdale once and came to the conclusion that there was really no point in leaving our perfect oasis! The resort is perfect for a romantic getaway (next time we are going with our husbands, and trust me, there will be a next time!), but if you go with a friend you'll feel right at home too. People actually dress for dinner - this is not a t-shirt & shorts place, which is oh so fun if you're used to being in mommy-mode. If you are looking for a restful, tranquil vacation with amazing dining and a decadent spa, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lasw710
Reviews.Content: We loved every second of our five-day stay at the Royal Palms Resort & Spa. The grounds were beautiful- well maintained and had a tropical feel. The pool is small- not great for laps, but wonderful for floating. I think the smallish number of chairs might be a problem when the hotel is fuller than it probably was when we were there. The umbrellas are huge and offered a lot of shade, but if you wanted sun you could have it (do you want to sit in the sun in 105 degree heat?). We stayed in room 138, which had the world's most comfortable bed, a nice sitting area, a flat-screen television with standard cable, a private area outside and a newly redone bathroom. Housekeeping kept the rooms spotless. We enjoyed turndown service every night and looked forward to cards and candies we would find. The restaurant is good, but expensive. You can eat at the lounge, where entrees range in price from about $14 to about $40. If you do, definitely try the tempura asparagus- it was a highlight! There is a $22 daily gratuity fee attached to your nightly stay, and it is totally worth it. I cannot stress enough how attentive the staff is. When we called for our car, the men actually ran to get it to us faster. The concierge was wonderful, and when we did have a mix-up with a resort activity we had signed up for but wasn't offered, they bent over backwards to make it up to us. We would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “simply great hotel with service to match”
Reviews.Author: Keith2402
Reviews.Content: Just had a wonderful six night stay at the Palms with my wife. Had a shock at check-in when they told me of the $22 a night service charge but it was worth every cent, due to the excellent friendly staff at the resort (special mention to the pool staff and the car valets), who earned it and more. Very few negatives and lots of positives. The pool area is not the largest and would be pushed to serve everyones needs when the hotel is full. However when it is quiet, as when we were there, then it is ideal. Staff keep you supplied with constant iced water (free of charge), food if required and move the parasols when required, so you do not over do the sunbathing (unless you realy do want to fry). Rooms comforable and there is a turn down service supplied at night. The attention to detail is excellent. Will be going back again as it also makes an excellent base to see the rest of Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Get Away”
Reviews.Author: enofh
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Royal Palms. The staff are friendly and helpful. It was my first stay in Phoenix. We booked a discounted room online. I didn't know what to expect. The grounds are beautiful. We stayed in their smallest room. It was large, clean and comfortable. If you book online, please remember you will be responsible for paying the resort fee. It was $22 per day during our stay. The fee is used to pay gratuity to the valet, bell staff and housekeepers. We ate a wonderful breakfast at T.C.'s. The dining room is very comfortable and beautiful. I can't wait to go back and stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Steaming hot but absolutely beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Meg3738
Reviews.Content: If you can't stand the heat, do not stay in Phoenix in July. If you can, or if you're there for any other reason, stay at the Royal Palms! This resort is small and romantic and the landscape is gorgeous; even in the heat of the summer, the grounds were lush and full. I was there with my husband, my parents, and my sister on a family vacation, but the resort was predominantly couples. The few families that came to the intimate pool left quickly when they saw that the atmosphere was quiet and not conducive to loud children. The service was absolutely unbelievable at every turn (Rick at the pool takes service to another level...) and, in the one case it wasn't (the spa did not have our appointments in its system), the extremely apologetic staff bent over backwards to accommodate us. The Royal Palms was such a breath of fresh air and a completely unexpected respite I would visit again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: zebedee70
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here in June. Having read the rave reviews we were somewhat disappointed. First impressions were certainly not good; the reception staff did not exactly fall over themselves to be helpful and the decor seemed a little faded. The pool area was very average and some new soft furnishing was clearly needed . Felt better when we had settled in- the room was large and comforatble and my wife loved the bath. Enjoyed an excellent meal in the restaurant though again the decoration was a little old fashoined. Highlight of stay was sitting in a courtyard with a bottle of wine under the stars. Liked the feel of the place in the evening with lots of clever lighting and quiet acoustic guitar. Overall it was ok. Think they will need to up their game if they want to maintain their prices. The spanish colonial theme is great but clearly needs a little refurbishment

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: birthdaygirl925
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal Palms Resort over Father's Day weekend and left with mixed emotions. We booked a standard room, and while it was clean and nicely appointed, it was quite small. The bath tub was ridiculous! An older person would have found it unuseable. We almost needed a step stool to get into it. We found the concierge to be helpful enough, but the front desk attendant seemed to have a forced smile and never mailed our postcards (after offering to do so). We had a delicious dinner at T. Cook's. Our table was disappointing, though. It was right next to the kitchen, even though we had made the reservation months in advance and were obviously hotel guests. On a brighter note, our food server could not have been more attentive and gracious. The grounds of the Royal Palms are pretty, and the valet attendants were very speedy and pleasant. However, we have stayed at many other four and five star resorts in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area and would probably not return to Royal Palms. We have found much better service, value, and accomodations at the Sanctuary and the Phoenician.

Reviews.Title: “Soooooo glad we chose the Royal Palms!!!”
Reviews.Author: dixienana
Reviews.Content: OMG!!! The Royal Palms is now our favorite place to stay in greater Phoenix. I treated my husband to a weekend there for his birthday in May, and was not really sure what to expect. We had previously stayed at the Biltmore, which was always delightful, but I thought we should explore something new. Lucky for us, our friends recommended this resort and it turned out to be one of those "where have you been all my life?" experiences. Everything, and I mean EVERYTHING, was PERFECT. We can't wait for a reason to get back up there, unbearable Phoenix heat and all (we live in Tucson and everyone knows it is always at least 10 degrees hotter in Phoenix than Tucson and even when it's over 100, it MATTERS). **Bonus Tip: for a lovely, intimate, absolutely five star meal, go to Christopher's at the Biltmore Plaza. It's delicious!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, intimate, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: UKLizzie
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Royal Palms and the fact that I keep returning despite there being so many great places to stay in Phoenix and Scottsdale should tell you something. I love the Royal Palms. The whole property is beautiful, the resort is small enough to feel intimate, and the service is always amazing. I like the Montevista Terrace rooms, which have a patio or balcony overlooking a central courtyard with a decorative pool and pretty sitting areas set around firepits. The rooms are a decent size and beautifully decorated with particularly nice bathrooms which have deep oval soaking tubs and separate shower cubicles. There is even a 'window (no glass, just an opening with shutters to close if you want privacy) cut into the wall between the bedroom and the bathroom which is a nice touch. The Estate rooms are basically the same, and in the same building, but don't have a patio or balcony and lack the view. The only downside is the smallish pool area. The pool is beautiful, the sunloungers very comfortable and the service great, but the pool area and the pool itself are quite small and so both can feel crowded and noisy if the hotel is busy. Luckily it's not a very child-friendly hotel so it tends to be groups of adults only, but even then it can get a bit frenetic and noisy at the pool which you might find annoying if you're looking for peace and quiet. Nevertheless, it's hard to find fault with anything and I've had 3 very enjoyable visits (March 07, Dec 07 and Apr08).

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: kayla73
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal place for business and leasure travelers. I would recommend the the new spa suites, they are wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: mcb1979
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the good fortune to spend one night at the Royal Palms in August. This resort is, quite frankly, the epitomy of luxury. You'll feel like you're in another world as soon as you arrive. We have stayed at many first-class resorts around the world and I would rank the Royal Palms in my top five. The service was impeccable. The grounds were breathtaking. Our room was lovely, and I adored the huge bathtub. When the staff found out that we were celebrating our anniversary, they left a plate of decadent sweets in our room. Our brunch at the restaurant was amazing. If you feel like venturing off the property, you must try Los Olivos for the best Mexican of your life. It's just a short drive away. There's also wonderful shopping nearby. That said, rest assured, you won't want to leave this oasis. I can't wait to return in the future. If you're look for a rejuvenating retreat, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: kadelia
Reviews.Content: Finally, a hotel were being rated five-star means you are treated as such. The service began weeks before we checked in with the concierge planning our pick-up at the airport, our spa treatments booked and our anniversary dinner set. Upon arrival, you feel like you've been transported to a tropical oasis (we stayed the night before we flew to Hawaii, people comment that the pictures I took at the Royal Palms look more like Hawaii than my actual Hawaii pictures!!!) Our room, one of the Alvadora Spa Suites was incredible--luxurious, intimate and perfect. Extra little touches, like smoothies after arrival, snacks waiting for you, made me think of this as a large-scale b&b! Our couple's massage was by far the BEST I have ever received and the atmosphere in the spa was the most relaxing I've experienced. Everything was top-notch and the amenities thoughtful and well appointed. Our anniversary dinner at the onsite T. Alexanders included thoughtful touches such as personalized menu's and rose petals scattered at the most private of tables. The attentive service was second to none and I can finally say I've experienced a stay in a five-star resort (others claim to be, but have all disappointed! Not so here!) Our early departure the next morning was made easier with coffee, fresh-made biscotti and a newspaper to go...again, the touches you expect only at a b&b were found here. Our driver commented that the President is fond of staying at the Royal Palms; we completely agree!

Reviews.Title: “Serene and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: guthrie16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monte Vista Terrace room for 2 nights and we were very sad to leave. The grounds are gorgeous and perfectly maintained. Everyone at the hotel, from the valet parkers to the front desk, provided impeccable service. The hotel is certainly geared towards romance and it did not disappoint. The room was beautifully appointed with shutters above the sunken tub that open on to the room. The resort was very quiet with only the sound of the fountains to lull you to sleep each night. The pool was small but very clean. They provide nice rafts to relax on as well as ice water with lemon. We had dinner at T Cooks and enjoyed sitting out on the terrace looking at the stars. Breakfast was also very good. The hotel is in very close proximity to Scottsdale, although it is listed as Phoenix we went to Scottsdale each day. We stayed the Biltmore next and were so bummed! We should have stayed at the Palms!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: alexshulman
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as a part of romantic trip to Arizona for 3 days. First 4 days were in Sanctuary at Camelback, and then moved to Royal Palms In summary one of the best places I ever stayed/see my travel places for comparison/ Superb service, location, pool,room, ambience I wish I can spend a week every year there

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: stellakaiser
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a wonderful 2 night 3 day stay at Royal Palms. We had a spa room which was absolutly wonderful. The bed was comfortable and the steam shower was a great touch. Rick and Jose at the pool were exceptional. The resort was booked that weekend but you would not have known. There were plently of seats open at the pool and we had no problem getting into the resturant. Our room services came extremely quick and the food exceeded expectations. I would recommend this resort to anyone looking to get away and have a nice relaxing vacation. My husband and I travel a lot and this is one of the best places we have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but probably not for families”
Reviews.Author: coolstone
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay. I did not select this hotel as we were with a group for a wedding. Our rooms were $567 per night with a $22.00 resort fee to cover gratuities. Very high I felt! The grounds of the resort are amazing. Lush with lots and lots of flowers. We stayed in two casitas connecting with King Beds. Which were perfect. Away from the main hotel with nice courtyards in front to enjoy breakfast! Ours had a small water fountain also. The rooms were above average with nice beds and comfortable furnishings. One room had a fireplace although not cool enough outside to use it. The bathroom was just OK. All the staff were courteous and helpful. Questions were answered immediately especially room service. I requested several special dishes with no problem. I would recommend this resort to others even though I had a slight issue with Jose by the pool. On our first morning to the resort we took our two children (5 & 9) to the pool. We were out early probably by 9:30 that morning. The pool area had a few guests already but not many. My children had only been in the pool a few minutes when Jose approached me to tell me my children had to quote, "not yell, horseplay, jump, splash or play Marco Polo in the pool." and that he was just telling me "before he got complaints". I was shocked. I've never been told this before at any other resort from Westin, Hyatt, Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons. I said I would tell them but they are children and they may make noise. Needless to say we didn't stay long by the pool. I was not told at check in there were restrictions on children using the pool so I was confused by this comment by Jose. The next day I checked with the front desk and they did not know why Jose would tell us that and that children are allowed in the pool area as long as they are accompanied by an adult. The Manager-Hillary did leave me a nice message in our room apologizing for this but we never did get an answer as to why we were told this. That same day we spent several hours by the pool and there were other children jumping and splashing all over the pool so I really don't understand why Jose told us this. While I would recommend this resort I would probably choose a different hotel if we return with our children. It's a great place for adults and my husband and I would stay here again but without our children.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: scottpaul80
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the best service and the most enjoyable time of your life, you need not look any farther than the Royal Palms. The four days and three nights spent at this luxurious resort, was not nearly enough. There was not one time during our entire visit that we were not treated like royalty.
